0.title: He's irritable & forgetful: Russia as Biden calls Putin 'murderous dictator'
0.article_body: Russia said US President Joe Biden's comments about President Vladimir Putin are "personal insults". Biden had called Putin a "war criminal" and a "murderous dictator". "Given such irritability from Biden, his fatigue and sometimes forgetfulness...fatigue that leads to aggressive statements, we'll not make harsh assessments so as not to cause more aggression," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said.

1.title: I can make a film with Shah Rukh Khan in my sleep: Farah Khan
1.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan has said that she can make a film with actor Shah Rukh Khan in her sleep. She added that when the timing is right, it will fall into place. Shah Rukh has worked in Farah's 'Main Hoon Na', 'Om Shanti Om' and 'Happy New Year'. She further said that her films should get mass acclaim.

2.title: Poland to propose peacekeeping mission for Ukraine at NATO summit: PM
2.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki on Friday said that Poland will formally submit a proposal for a peacekeeping mission in Ukraine at the next NATO summit. Notably, Morawiecki and the Prime Ministers of Slovenia and the Czech Republic had recently visited the Ukrainian capital Kyiv despite the ongoing war. Several NATO nations have provided military aid to Ukraine amid the conflict.

3.title: Don't politicise legitimate energy transactions: Govt sources
3.article_body: India's legitimate energy transactions should not be politicised and countries that are either self-sufficient in oil or are importing from Russia cannot credibly advocate restrictive trading, government sources said. The remarks come amid reports of India purchasing discounted crude oil from Russia, which is facing international sanctions over its invasion of Ukraine.

4.title: I call him Pammi aunty: Pooja Hegde on 'Cirkus' co-star Ranveer Singh
4.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde opened up about sharing screen space with Ranveer Singh in the upcoming comedy film 'Cirkus' and said, "He is like full entertainment." "I call him Pammi aunty. He's just too much fun to be around, and he's so observant of everybody," she added. "We make a great onscreen pair also," Pooja further said.

5.title: World C'ships silver-medallist Kidambi loses in 2nd round of All England
5.article_body: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth lost in second round of men's singles at All England Championships in Birmingham. Fifth-seeded Anthony Sinisuka Ginting beat the World Championships silver-medallist 9-21, 21-18, 21-19. Meanwhile, the Indian duo of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty entered men's doubles quarter-finals after defeating Germany's Mark Lamsfuss and Marvin Seidel 21-7, 21-7.

6.title: Nation celebrating Holi, Shab-e-Barat on same day, this is beauty of India: Naqvi
6.article_body: As the country celebrates Holi and Shab-e-Barat on Friday, Union Minister for Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that this is the beauty of our country that the people celebrate all festivals. "This is Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat," Naqvi added. "Holi is the symbol of social unity, communal harmony and brotherhood," Naqvi wrote while sharing pictures on Twitter.

7.title: No player has hit a Test ton faster than Shikhar Dhawan on debut
7.article_body: Batter Shikhar Dhawan smashed the fastest hundred on a Test debut off 85 balls against Australia in the Mohali Test that ended on March 18, 2013. Dhawan overtook West Indies' Dwayne Smith, who slammed Test ton on debut off 93 balls against South Africa in 2004. Dhawan is among the 16 Indians who have hit a century on Test debut.

8.title: 98-yr-old Ukrainian woman who fought World War II offers to fight Russia, govt shares pic
8.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Twitter to share a picture of 98-year-old Olha Tverdokhlibova, who offered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. Olha is a World War II veteran, the ministry stated. "Despite all the merits and experience was denied, though, because of age. We are sure, she will celebrate another victory soon in Kyiv!" it further wrote.

9.title: Norway preparing to host 1 lakh refugees amid conflict in Ukraine: PM
9.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday announced that Norway is preparing to host up to 1 lakh people fleeing the conflict in Ukraine. Norway expects to receive around 30,000 refugees from Ukraine this year, he said. Around 2,000 refugees have arrived in Norway so far and the Norwegian government said that it'll soon receive an additional 5,250 people.

10.title: 1 killed, 4 injured after parts of Russian missile fall on building in Ukraine
10.article_body: One person was killed and four others were injured after parts of a Russian missile fell on a residential building in Ukraine's capital Kyiv on Friday, emergencies services said. Twelve people were rescued and 98 people were evacuated from the five-storey building, the services added. Over 700 people have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack, the United Nations said.

11.title: Which are the world's top 10 happiest countries as India in bottom 11?
11.article_body: According to the UN-sponsored World Happiness Report, Finland has been ranked the happiest country in the world, followed by Denmark, Iceland, Switzerland, Netherlands and Luxembourg. Sweden has been ranked seven. Other countries in the top 10 are Norway, Israel and New Zealand. India has been ranked 136 among 146 countries, and Afghanistan has been ranked as the least happiest country.

12.title: Actor Vishal feeds over 200 elderly people on Puneeth's birth anniversary
12.article_body: On late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's birth anniversary on Thursday, Vishal served food to more than 200 elderly people across various old age shelters in and around Chennai. The actor, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, shared a video on Twitter, writing, "Nothing else would make my friend Puneeth more happy...on his birthday than helping these lovely ones."

13.title: Smeared in colours, CRPF jawans celebrate Holi in Srinagar
13.article_body: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel celebrated Holi in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Friday. They smeared colours on each other and danced to Holi songs to celebrate the festival. "We are enjoying the festival. Even if we are away from our family members but the personnel are also part of our family," a jawan said.

14.title: Samoa reports its first unexplained COVID-19 case in community, goes into lockdown
14.article_body: The Pacific island nation of Samoa has sealed its borders as it entered a nationwide lockdown after recording its first unexplained case of COVID-19 in the community. The case was detected in a 29-year-old on the main island of Upolu. A government report leaked online indicated the woman had taken part in church services, and visited places including a hospital.

15.title: Want to shut all 800 restaurants but our Russian partner refused: Burger King owner
15.article_body: Restaurant Brands International, the parent company of Burger King, said it wants to immediately shut all its 800 restaurants in Russia but its Russian joint venture partner has "refused" to do so.  "We can't unilaterally suspend operations" because it's a "complicated legal process", it added. Earlier, the company suspended corporate support for Russian locations amid Ukraine's invasion.

16.title: Britney Spears deletes Instagram account again, fans express concern
16.article_body: Singer Britney Spears' Instagram account was deactivated once again on Wednesday afternoon, following which many of her fans took to social media to express concern. One fan wrote, "Seems like something is going on, we'll see," while another tweeted, "Me right now panicking #BritneySpears." ET Online has reported that the singer is taking "a well-deserved break as many celebrities do".

17.title: Wrestler Sangram Singh announces wedding with Payal Rohatgi in July
17.article_body: Wrestler Sangram Singh on Thursday announced his upcoming wedding with longtime girlfriend actress Payal Rohatgi in July. Sangram tweeted that their wedding was scheduled for March but was postponed amid work commitments. This comes after Payal broke down on reality show 'Lock Upp', saying it has been 12 years since she's been dating Sangram and she wants to get married.

18.title: Fake doctor cheats Pune woman of ₹22 lakh; met her on matrimonial site
18.article_body: A woman in Pune was duped of ₹22 lakh by fraudsters who posed as a doctor on a matrimonial website. She allegedly transferred the amount to them on pretexts like air travel expenditure, gold tax, etc. over a period of eight months. She filed a complaint with the police after realising that the person she met online does not exist.

19.title: Devotees throng at Vrindavan’s Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi
19.article_body: With sweets and colours in their hands, devotees gathered in huge numbers at Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi on Friday. They were seen standing in queues to get a glimpse of their deity, Krishna at the temple. They also threw colours on the devotees gathered at the temple. Vrindavan holds a historic significance for the festival of Holi.

20.title: Godzilla actor Akira Takarada dies aged 87
20.article_body: Japanese actor Akira Takarada, known for his role in the original Godzilla, has died at the age of 87. Takarada's death was announced by Toho Studios, the production company responsible for the 1954 movie. In Godzilla, Takarada played Hideto Ogata, a sailor who works with the Japanese Coast Guard after Godzilla sinks a boat.

21.title: ₹2,000 cash found at unicorn founder's home after 3-day I-T raid on Infra.Market
21.article_body: The I-T department conducted a three-day raid at the offices of unicorn startup Infra.Market and the residences of Founders Souvik Sengupta and Aaditya Sharda. It found ₹2,000 in cash and jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh at Sengupta's residence and cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh each at Sharda's residence. No unaccounted cash or assets were found at its offices, Moneycontrol reported.

22.title: About 300 ships carrying grain exports stopped by Russian forces
22.article_body: Russian forces have stopped around 300 ships carrying grain exports from leaving the Black Sea amid the ongoing war in Ukraine. The administrator of the Panamanian Maritime Authority Noriel Arauz said three Panamanian-flagged ships have been struck by Russian fire since the invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Russia produces nearly 80 million metric tons of wheat per year.

23.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to be screened for Bihar MLAs, MLCs in Patna on Mar 25
23.article_body: The Bihar government is going to arrange a special screening of Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' for MLAs and MLCs of the state. The film will be screened in Patna at 6.30 pm on March 25. "The movie is based on the plight of Kashmiri Pandits...It needs to be watched by more and more people," Deputy CM Tarkishore Prasad said.

24.title: 'Skip Intro' button used 136 mn times a day, saves users’ 195 years: Netflix
24.article_body: In a blog post, Netflix has revealed that its 'Skip Intro' button is pressed about 136 million times each day, saving users across the world a cumulative time of 195 years. Explaining how the ‘Skip Intro’ feature was created five years ago, Netflix stated that 15% of the time customers were manually advancing the series within the first five minutes.

25.title: Japan announces further sanctions on Russian officials, arms exporter
25.article_body: Japan on Friday said it will impose sanctions against 15 Russian individuals and nine organisations including the state-owned arms exporter Rosoboronexport. Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Japan's finance ministry said Japan has sanctioned 76 individuals, seven banks and 12 organisations. "These sanctions hit at the heart of Russia's war machine," US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel said.

26.title: Court acquits 2 serving life imprisonment for double murder in Pune
26.article_body: Two men who were serving life imprisonment in connection with the murder of an elderly couple in the Pune district were acquitted by Bombay High Court on Thursday. The couple was murdered in 2009. The court said the trial court was not justified in arriving at the conclusion that the prosecution has proved its case beyond a reasonable doubt.

27.title: UK revokes Russian channel RT's licence amid probe into Ukraine war coverage
27.article_body: UK media regulator has revoked the licence of Russian-backed broadcaster RT amid probe into the impartiality of its coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We don't consider RT's licensee, ANO TV Novosti, fit and proper to hold...UK broadcast licence," the regulator, Ofcom, said. This move by Ofcom shows that "it's nothing more than a tool of government", RT said.

28.title: India celebrates Holi in Auckland ahead of Australia match in Women's WC
28.article_body: India, who are currently playing in 2022 Women's World Cup, celebrated Holi in Auckland before their next match against Australia on Saturday. BCCI Women posted a picture on Twitter and wrote, "Ringing in the festivities post practice in Auckland. Here's Team India wishing everyone a Happy Holi all the way from New Zealand." India have two wins from four matches.

29.title: Train services between India, Bangladesh likely to resume from March 26
29.article_body: The train services of Maitree Express and Bandhan Express between India and Bangladesh are likely to resume from March 26, said the Ministry of Railways on Thursday. The decision is subjected to the clearance of the Ministry of Home Affairs, the Railways added. The train services between the two countries were suspended in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

30.title: NASA rolls out its mega Moon rocket for 1st time, shares pics
30.article_body: NASA has rolled out its mega Moon rocket for the first time. The vehicle, known as the Space Launch System (SLS), along with the Orion capsule atop, was taken to the pad at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida to conduct a dummy countdown. NASA is targeting May as the earliest window for Artemis-1, an uncrewed lunar mission.

31.title: Oil protestor ties himself by neck to goalpost during PL match, pic goes viral
31.article_body: Everton-Newcastle United Premier League match was held up for eight minutes on Thursday after a protestor tied himself to the goalpost at the Gwladys Street end of Goodison Park. The invader was wearing a jersey with the words 'Just Stop Oil'. "[UK] government must end all new fossil fuel supply projects," the group claiming responsibility for the stunt said.

32.title: Robert Pattinson's The Batman crosses $500 million at worldwide box office
32.article_body: Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman' has earned over $500 million at the worldwide box office. The film, which was made on a budget of $200 million, earned over $258.3 million in the US and over $247 million in international markets, as per a report. "We congratulate...the entire cast and crew on this wonderful benchmark," Warner Bros Pictures chairman Toby Emmerich said.

33.title: TV actress among those rescued as prostitution racket busted in Goa
33.article_body: The Goa Crime Branch on Friday said it has arrested a Hyderabad-based man named Hafiz Syed Bilal and rescued three women, including a television actress, after busting a prostitution racket. Two of the rescued women, including the TV actress, are from Virar near Mumbai. "Information was received...and accordingly a trap was laid," the police said.

34.title: Jharkhand's mob lynching bill is not legal: BJP state President
34.article_body: Jharkhand BJP President Deepak Prakash has termed the state's 'Prevention of Mob Violence and Mob Lynching Bill, 2021' as "not legal" and a bill passed by the state assembly for "politics of appeasement". He backed the state Governor Ramesh Bais for returning the draft of the bill and also stated that the bill will "disrupt social harmony" in Jharkhand.

35.title: Narmada project participating states yet to pay ₹7,225 cr to Gujarat: CM
35.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel said that Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Rajasthan, the three participating states of the Sardar Sarovar Narmada Yojana, are yet to give ₹7,225 crore to Gujarat. Madhya Pradesh has to pay ₹4,953.42 crore, Maharashtra ₹1,715.67 crore and Rajasthan ₹556 crore to Gujarat. In the past two years, Madhya Pradesh did not pay anything, Patel added.

36.title: Kim's boyfriend Pete Davidson won't be going to space on Blue Origin flight
36.article_body: American comedian Pete Davidson, who's currently dating socialite Kim Kardashian, will not be flying to space on Blue Origin's upcoming spaceflight, billionaire Jeff Bezos-led space tourism company said as it delayed the launch. The development comes days after Blue Origin announced Davidson would be one of the six passengers on its next spaceflight. It did not provide any further detail.

37.title: Taliban bans broadcast of all foreign TV shows in Afghanistan: Report
37.article_body: The Taliban has banned the broadcast of all foreign TV series in Afghanistan, as per a report. A participant at the meeting of Afghan broadcasters said, "The Taliban clearly said to stop showing any foreign TV series translated into Dari or Pashto [official languages of Afghanistan]." Report added that the authorities said they won't accept any excuses for violating this.

38.title: Diljit Dosanjh to portray singer Amar Singh Chamkila in his biopic: Reports
38.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has reportedly been roped in to play the role of Amar Singh Chamkila in an upcoming film based on the life of the late musician. The biopic will be directed by filmmaker Imtiaz Ali. Amar and his wife, Amarjot, were killed, along with two members of their band in March 1988 in an assassination which remains unresolved.

39.title: I'd give anything to see you smile 1 more time: Leone on mom's death anniversary
39.article_body: Taking to Instagram on Friday, Sunny Leone penned a note remembering her mother on her death anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her parents, she wrote, "14 years ago today you left us but every day I miss you more...and would give anything to see you smile and call me Googu one more time. Love you Mumma!"

40.title: It's time to break away from societal stereotypes of wedding: Yami
40.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has said it's high time to break away from societal stereotypes for wedding ceremonies. She further said she'd have opted for a minimalist wedding even if it wasn't held during the pandemic. "I would have still worn my mother's sari, my grandmother's nath, dupatta and the aatheru (traditional Kashmiri ear ornament) given by my in-laws," Yami added.

41.title: Rare and deadly virus found in ticks in 6 US states: Study
41.article_body: Scientists have found a rare but potentially deadly Heartland virus in lone star ticks in Georgia. Its RNA has been detected in immature and mature ticks in Missouri, Alabama, Illinois, Kansas and New York so far. In 2009, two men were hospitalised with high fever, diarrhoea, muscle pain and symptoms similar to Lyme disease marking the virus' first case.

42.title: Andaman MP urges Lt Guv to put disaster machinery on high alert ahead of cyclone
42.article_body: Andaman and Nicobar Islands MP Kuldeep Rai Sharma has urged the Lieutenant Governor to put the islands' disaster management machinery on high alert after the IMD predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21. Rai has also requested Lieutenant Governor Admiral (Retd) DK Joshi to declare a holiday in schools and colleges on March 19 and 21.

43.title: I played Calendar in Mr. India, then did that in 150 films: Satish
43.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has stated that he played Calendar in 1987 film 'Mr. India' and everyone thought that he can only make people laugh. "And I ended up doing that in 150 films!" the actor added. He further said that earlier an actor could get typecast very quickly, adding it was an "innocent age" with no exposure to world cinema.

44.title: May the spirit of Holi fill our lives with happiness, peace: Kohli
44.article_body: India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter to share his wishes on the occasion of Holi. "May the spirit of this festival fill our lives with happiness and peace. Happy Holi to all," he wrote. VVS Laxman tweeted, "May the colours of Holi spread peace, happiness, love and prosperity all around. Wishing you a blessed and Happy Holi."

45.title: Delhi education department asks schools to step up vaccination of 12-14 age group
45.article_body: The Directorate of Education (Delhi) has asked schools to take charge of getting their students in the 12-14 age group vaccinated. In a directive issued by the directorate, the class teachers must ensure that parents are informed to inoculate their children. Schools designated as COVID-19 vaccination centres (CVCs) have been asked to make provisions for separate rooms and extra staff.

46.title: Mamata Banerjee slams EC for rescheduling board exams over elections
46.article_body: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday slammed the election commission for rescheduling class 12 board exams in West Bengal due to byelections of Asansol Lok Sabha seat and Ballygunge assembly constituency. "Had the byelections been conducted along with the recent assembly elections in the five states, students would not have to face this problem," she said.

47.title: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri gets 'Y' category security: Reports
47.article_body: The Centre has granted a 'Y' category security to Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, the director of 'The Kashmir Files,’ reports said. The 'Y' category security cover involves the deployment of four to five armed commandos in close proximity of the protectee. After the release of the movie based on the lives of Kashmiri Pandits, Agnihotri was receiving threats on social media.

48.title: Delhi workers who lost income due to construction ban to get ₹5,000
48.article_body: Delhi government has decided to give ₹5,000 aid to 83,183 workers who lost their income due to the construction ban amid pollution spike in 2021. "These workers are the builders of our nation...Construction activities were banned in Delhi earlier which affected the livelihood of workers," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. There are 11 lakh construction workers in Delhi, he added.

49.title: 30 stranded whales die on beach in New Zealand: Govt
49.article_body: New Zealand's Department of Conservation has said that around 30 pilot whales have died after being stranded on a beach. "The cause of this stranding is not known, but Golden Bay is a high stranding area with Farewell Spit hooking around the northern entrance into the bay," it added. About 34 pilot whales were stranded in the area.

50.title: Ukrainian CEO featured in Forbes' rich list stays behind in Kharkiv to help rescuers
50.article_body: A Ukrainian businessman, ranked among wealthiest Ukrainians, chose to stay back in Kharkiv to help local defenders and rescuers, a media report said. Vsevolod Kozhemyaka, CEO of Agrotrade Group, has been posting images and videos related to attacks on Kharkiv on Instagram. He was on the 88th spot in Forbes' list of 100 richest people in Ukraine in 2020.

51.title: Western sanctions starting to have real impact on Russia: France
51.article_body: Sanctions imposed by Western countries on Russia over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine are starting to have a "real impact", French government spokesman Gabriel Attal said on Friday. "We hope these sanctions will force [Russian President] Vladimir Putin to change his plans," he added. Earlier this week, the European Union member states agreed on the fourth package of sanctions against Russia.

52.title: Vicky, Katrina share pics from their 1st Holi after wedding
52.article_body: Actors Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif took to Instagram to share pictures from their first Holi together after their wedding. The pictures also feature Vicky Kaushal's parents and his brother Sunny Kaushal. Vicky and Katrina got married on December 9 last year in a traditional Hindu ceremony at the Six Senses Fort Barwara in Sawai Madhopur, Rajasthan.

53.title: Haryana man claims Apple Watch's ECG feature saved his life; CEO Tim Cook replies
53.article_body: A 34-year-old Haryana man claimed that an Apple Watch saved his life after its ECG feature detected irregularities. Nitesh Chopra said he went to the hospital and the angiography revealed there was a 99.9% blockage in his arteries. His wife then emailed Apple CEO Tim Cook thanking him, to which Cook replied saying, "I'm so glad you sought medical attention."

54.title: 103-year-old man jailed for 10 years for sexually assaulting 10-yr-old girl in TN
54.article_body: A 103-year-old man has been convicted and sentenced to 10 years rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting a 10-year-old girl in 2018. Police said the man, a retired government school headmaster, lured the girl promising to get her a chocolate. Her parents came to know about the crime when she complained of stomach ache.

55.title: Not easy for Mayank to lead PBKS who haven't done justice to talent: Gavaskar
55.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said it is not going to be easy for Mayank Agarwal to lead PBKS, who have not done justice to their talent over the years. PBKS have reached the playoffs in an edition of the IPL twice in 15 seasons. PBKS will play their first game of IPL 2022 on March 27 against RCB.

56.title: 100 endangered vultures found dead in Assam, food poisoning suspected
56.article_body: Carcasses of almost 100 endangered vultures were found in the Chhaygaon area of Kamrup, Assam on Thursday. Dimpi Bora, District Forest Officer (DFO), said, "We have found some bones nearby the carcasses. We suspect that the vultures died after eating the poisonous goat carcass." She further added that the actual cause of death will come out in the post-mortem report.

57.title: Russian forces raping women aged over 60 before hanging them: Ukrainian MP
57.article_body: Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko, while speaking to journalists in the House of Commons, said that  Vladimir Putin has "changed his strategy to target the most vulnerable groups of women and children". She added that Russian forces are raping women aged over 60 before executing them. She further said that several women died by suicide after being sexually abused.

58.title: Kolkata Knight Riders launch their new jersey, share pic
58.article_body: Two-time IPL champions Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) have launched their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. The new jersey features a lot more gold palette in the kit. KKR CEO Venky Mysore and captain Shreyas Iyer were present at the jersey launch. KKR will face Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in IPL 2022 opener on March 26.

59.title: Kyrgios shares screenshots of Instagram chat with ball kid he almost hit with racquet
59.article_body: After his Indian Wells Masters quarter-final defeat against Rafael Nadal, Nick Kyrgios hurled his racquet on the ground. The racquet bounced away and almost hit a ball kid. Kyrgios put out an apology on Instagram after the match and sought help in tracking down the ball kid. He later shared screenshots of his Instagram chat with the ball kid.

60.title: Putin won't be able to use Botox due to sanctions: Reports
60.article_body: Due to the sanction imposed on Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine, President Vladimir Putin won't be able to use Botox, reports said. Abbvie, which owns the wrinkle treatment product, has said it has temporarily suspended operations for all its aesthetic products in Russia, reports added. The use of Botox by Putin has been widely reported by several media outlets.

61.title: Willing to provide Ukraine S-300s if NATO fills gap: Slovakia
61.article_body: Slovakia's Defence Minister Jaroslav Nad said his country is willing to provide Ukraine with S-300 air defences if NATO provides a replacement. US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin, who was speaking alongside the Slovakian minister, declined to say whether the US might be willing to fill the gap. Ukraine has appealed to Western nations for air defences to fight Russian invasion.

62.title: Anyone thinking women’s cricket is boring has got their head in sand: Shikha
62.article_body: India Women pacer Shikha Pandey tweeted, "Anyone who still says or thinks women's cricket is boring has clearly got their head in the sand and is not watching it." "Agree with you. It is competitive and interesting," read a response to her tweet. "It is more exciting than men's cricket as the latter has become so predictable," stated another reaction.

63.title: I will add Babar in 'Fab 5': Saba Karim on choosing between Babar, Rohit
63.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said he will add Babar Azam if the 'Fab Four' is to be expanded to 'Fab Five' for Test cricket, ahead of India skipper Rohit Sharma. "Rohit...because his impact is fantastic. He is an ultimate match-winner," responded former India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi. Babar scored 196 in the second innings of Pakistan's Karachi Test against Australia.

64.title: Has very limited talent, shots but good intention: Akhtar on Rizwan's 104*
64.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Muhammad Rizwan who scored an unbeaten 104 in Pakistan's Karachi Test against Australia, former Pakistani pacer Shoaib Akhtar said he has very limited talent and shots but good intention. "I feel the way Rizwan plays, he will be remembered for years to come," added Akhtar. "Rizwan plays like there's no pressure...at all," stated Akhtar.

65.title: Not at liberty to refuse players chance to take part in IPL 2022: CSA
65.article_body: With no IPL-bound players like Kagiso Rabada selected for South Africa's Tests against Bangladesh, Cricket South Africa said it is not at liberty to refuse players the chance to take part in IPL 2022. South Africa Test skipper Dean Elgar had earlier said players should remember that performances for the national team earned them a chance to play in IPL.

66.title: Re-designate Chennai as embarkation point for Haj pilgrims: TN CM to Centre
66.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has requested the Centre to take steps to re-designate Chennai as an embarkation point for the Haj 2022 pilgrims. Every year over 4,000 Haj pilgrims from Tamil Nadu proceed on the pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia from Chennai, Stalin added. Pilgrims from Tamil Nadu are made to travel over 700 kilometres to Cochin, the CM stated.

67.title: Russian fast-food chain reveals logo nearly identical to McDonald's
67.article_body: A Russian fast-food chain called Uncle Vanya has filed to trademark a logo that looks nearly identical to Golden Arches of McDonald's. The logo that shows the Cyrillic letter 'Ve', representing 'V' in Vanya, also uses the red and yellow colour scheme associated with McDonald's. After McDonald's shut 850 restaurants, Russia's State Duma suggested replacing it with Uncle Vanya.

68.title: Mumbai Police's 'Let's not Holi-cinate' post goes viral
68.article_body: Mumbai Police's post on Holi, that read, "Let's not Holi-cinate," has gone viral on social media. "Play with colors, not imagine them! We will catch you 'red-handed' otherwise," Mumbai Police wrote. Reacting to the post, social media users wrote, "Nailed it! Totally savage," and "Bang on Creative Team. Salute."

69.title: Aircraft repair plant in Lviv destroyed by Russian cruise missiles: Ukraine
69.article_body: Several missiles hit an aircraft repair plant in the Ukrainian city of Lviv on Friday, destroying its building, the city's Mayor Andriy Sadovy said. The plant wasn't in operation at the time of the strike and there were no casualties, he added. The plant was struck by cruise missiles launched from the direction of the Black Sea, Ukraine's military said.

70.title: ISKCON temple attacked by mob of 200 people shouting 'Allahu Akbar' in Bangladesh
70.article_body: An ISKCON temple was attacked by a mob of around 200 people shouting "Allahu Akbar" in Bangladesh's Dhaka, with videos of the incident surfacing on social media. Commenting on the attack, the Hindu American Foundation (HAF) said, "They vandalised the temple, murti, and looted money and other valuable things. At least 3 Hindu devotees were injured during this attack."

71.title: Rafael Nadal beats Nick Kyrgios in quarter-final at Indian Wells
71.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated Nick Kyrgios 7-6(7-0), 5-7, 6-4 in the quarter-final match at Indian Wells Masters on Thursday. Nadal will now play against compatriot Carlos Alcaraz Garfia in the semi-final on Saturday. After the match, Nadal said, "Nick is one of these players that you're going to have problems with when he's motivated, so I'm happy for the victory."

72.title: Sanjay Dutt meets former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf in Dubai; picture goes viral
72.article_body: Bollywood actor Sanjay Dutt met former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf reportedly at a gym in Dubai. In a picture that has been shared widely on social media, Musharraf can be seen sitting in a wheelchair while Sanjay is pointing towards something. Several reports stated that Sanjay and Musharraf met accidentally.

73.title: When we were complete: Neetu shares old video of Raj Kapoor's Holi party
73.article_body: Raj Kapoor's daughter-in-law and actress Neetu Kapoor on Friday wished her fans and followers on the occasion of Holi. Taking to Instagram, she shared an old video from one of Raj's Holi parties. The one-minute video also featured the actress' late actor-husband Rishi Kapoor. "When we were complete when there was love warmth. Happy Holi," Neetu wrote.

74.title: Sara's outlook towards work is so refreshing: 'Gaslight' co-star Vikrant
74.article_body: Vikrant Massey, who's set to share the screen space with Sara Ali Khan in the upcoming film 'Gaslight', spoke about his co-star and said that she is wonderful and full of energy. "Her outlook towards her work, the way she sees the world, is so refreshing," he added. The suspense drama will also feature Chitrangda Singh.

75.title: When daughter saw poster of Abhay 2, she asked 'Why is daddy so angry': Kunal
75.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu has said when his four-year-old daughter, Inaaya, saw the poster of the web show 'Abhay 2', she asked, "Why is he (Kunal) looking so angry?" "Then we made her understand papa is playing a cop, whose job is to scare people," he added. "She has an idea that we do something where we get respected," Kunal said.

76.title: Prima facie proof that Deshmukh used influence in police transfers: Court
76.article_body: Rejecting former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh's bail, a court said that there is prima facie proof that he exercised his influence in the transfer of police officials. He was arrested in November 2021 by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money-laundering case. Deshmukh was accused of accepting bribes along with the co-accused Sachin Waze.

77.title: Can't penalise parties for not fulfilling promises: Allahabad HC
77.article_body: The Allahabad High Court observed that political parties can't be penalised for being unable to fulfil the promises made in their election manifesto. The court ruled after dismissing the petition filed by Khurshidurehman S Rehman who sought a criminal case against the BJP for allegedly failing to fulfil the promises made during the Lok Sabha elections in 2014.

78.title: Chennai boy solves Rubik's Cube in 14.32 secs on bicycle, sets Guinness World Record
78.article_body: A boy from Chennai has created a Guinness World Record by solving Rubik's Cube in just 14.32 seconds while riding a bicycle after working on his skills for two years. "Jayadharshan Venkatesan...was steering, pedalling and solving this cube whilst keeping his balance," Guinness World Records said, sharing his video on Instagram. Jayadharshan's achievement is put under the category of "speedcubing".

79.title: Mumbai Police removes 358 abandoned vehicles causing traffic congestion in city
79.article_body: Mumbai Police on Thursday removed 358 abandoned vehicles, which were clogging the roads leading to traffic congestion and bottlenecks in the city. Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey took to Twitter to say that police are now looking for bigger lorries to move the abandoned vehicles to Deonar. Pandey said police received "great support" from the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).

80.title: Man stabs teacher 101 times, 30 years after "humiliation" at school in Belgium
80.article_body: A 37-year-old man who said he felt "humiliated" by his teacher in primary school has confessed to stabbing her to death in 2020, Belgian prosecutors said on Thursday. Gunter Uwents, who stabbed the teacher 101 times, said he never got over comments Maria Verlinden made about him in early 1990s. The murder had gone unsolved despite repeated Belgian police enquiries.

81.title: Wealthy Russians have up to $214 billion stashed in Swiss bank accounts
81.article_body: Wealthy Russians have stashed up to $214 billion in secretive Swiss bank accounts, the Swiss Bankers Association (SBA) has revealed. However, SBA said the amount of Russian wealth held in Switzerland was small compared with total assets held in the country. Switzerland "must do everything possible to turn off the money taps", Social Democrats' co-president Mattea Meyer said.

82.title: Chinese jet enters Taiwan air defence zone; 12th intrusion this month
82.article_body: Chinese fighter jet entered Taiwan's air defence identification zone (ADIZ) on Thursday, marking the 12th intrusion this month. In response, Taiwan issued radio warnings, sent planes, and deployed air defence missile systems to track the Chinese aircraft. Reportedly, 38 Chinese planes, including 26 fighter jets and nine spotter planes, have been spotted in Taiwan's ADIZ in March so far.

83.title: US man caring for his partner in Ukraine hospital killed while waiting in bread line
83.article_body: A US citizen who had been caring for his partner in a Ukrainian hospital was killed by Russian fire as he waited in a bread line after briefly stepping out to buy food, his family said on Thursday. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken confirmed the death of the American, identified by his sisters as Jimmy Hill.

84.title: 3 arrested in connection with 60 chain-snatching incidents in NCR in 2 yrs
84.article_body: Haryana Police has arrested three persons in connection with at least 60 incidents of chain-snatching in National Capital Region (NCR) in the past two years. Police have also seized a motorcycle, a gold chain, a locally-made revolver and three live cartridges from the accused. Police added that the accused confessed to committing chain-snatching in Rewari, Dharuhera and Gurugram.

85.title: Pressure tournaments are coming, want to see how Rohit reacts: Hogg
85.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said he wants to see how Team India captain Rohit Sharma reacts under pressure, with crucial tournaments like a four-match Test series at home against Australia coming up. "Will he keep that same calm body language or will we see a little bit of temper?" added Hogg. "[It will]...be tough for Rohit," stated Hogg.

86.title: Delhi records season's warmest day as temperature rises to 36.1°C
86.article_body: Delhi on Thursday recorded the season's warmest day as the maximum temperature reached 36.1°C, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "In the coming days, the temperature is expected to rise but it will not touch 40°C as there would be winds," an IMD scientist RK Jenamani added. The minimum temperature in Delhi on Thursday was recorded at 19.9°C, IMD stated.

87.title: 88-yr-old man booked for raping 11-yr-old girl kills self in Gurugram
87.article_body: An 88-year-old man, who was booked for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl, died by suicide in Gurugram, police said. The girl's mother alleged that the suspect lured her daughter by offering her a sweet and raped her at his house, police added. The man allegedly killed himself after he came to know that the victim's family had approached the police.

88.title: 15 arrested for pelting stones at security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar
88.article_body: At least 15 persons have been arrested for allegedly pelting stones at security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar. The incident took place after three terrorists were killed in an encounter and the site was being cleared to ensure citizens' safety, police said. "In order to disperse the mob, smoke shells had to be used," police added in a statement.

89.title: Italy ready to rebuild bombed Ukrainian theatre: Culture Min
89.article_body: Italy is ready to rebuild a theatre in the besieged Ukrainian city Mariupol which was destroyed by a bomb attack, Culture Minister Dario Franceschini said. According to Ukrainian authorities, the theatre was bombed by Russia while people were sheltering in it. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked the minister. "Together we will rebuild the country to the last brick," Zelenskyy said.

90.title: What could become costlier in India due to the war in Ukraine?
90.article_body: Global prices of commodities and fuel have soared to unprecedented levels amid the war in Ukraine. Edible oil, food grains, corn could become costlier in India due to the war. Rare metals such as nickel, platinum, palladium, and gold could become costlier as Russia is one of the biggest exporters, and sanctions have stopped the metals from reaching global market.

91.title: 800 employees fired by UK ferry firm in a 3-minute pre-recorded Zoom video
91.article_body: UK ferry company P&O Ferries has fired 800 crew in a three-minute pre-recorded Zoom video, saying that its vessels will now "be primarily crewed by a third-party crew provider". "Your final day of employment is today," an executive said in the video. The company has denied claims that it sent security guards with handcuffs to take crew off the ships.

92.title: Horse mussels under threat due to conservation failures: Study
92.article_body: Horse mussels, a species of giant mollusc found in the UK waters could be at risk due to unprotected areas of the sea, a study has found. Marine experts have described the beds of these molluscs as biodiversity hotspots. Marine protected areas (MPAs) were also introduced to protect them but due to conservation failure, the species is at risk.

93.title: Who is a war criminal?
93.article_body: The term 'war criminal' applies to anyone who violates a set of rules adopted by world leaders known as the law of armed conflict. The rules govern how countries behave in times of war. The violations of the rules that amount to war crimes include deliberately targeting civilians, using disproportionate force, using human shields and taking hostages.

94.title: Pune Metro to rename Bhosari, Budhwar Peth stations after citizens complain
94.article_body: The Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited, which is implementing the Pune Metro project, has decided to change the names of at least two stations – Bhosari and Budhwar Peth. Officials said they have been receiving complaints regarding the names of the two stations due to confusion among commuters. "We will soon send a request to the...state government," an official said.

95.title: 53-yr-old man gets life sentence for raping minor stepdaughter in Maha
95.article_body: A sessions court in Palghar convicted a 53-year-old man for raping his 15-year-old stepdaughter and sentenced him to life in jail. In an FIR filed in 2017, the girl had alleged her step-father continued to rape her even after she became pregnant. Her mother had married the accused after the girl's father passed away when she was six months old.

96.title: Aishwarya remembers dad on death anniversary, shares his old pic with Aaradhya
96.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan took to Instagram to share a post remembering her late father Krishnaraj Rai on his death anniversary. She shared an old picture of her father with his granddaughter Aaradhya, and wrote, "Love you eternally dearest darling daddyyy-ajjaaa. Our guardian-angel forever and beyond…thank youuu and love you."

97.title: His defence was not the greatest: Harbhajan on Ponting's 'vulnerability'
97.article_body: Discussing Ricky Ponting whom he dismissed 10 times in Tests, more than any other bowler, Harbhajan Singh said, "Ponting used to defend with very hard hands...That...made him vulnerable. His defence was not the greatest." "My bounce was something he could not play as well as...other bowlers," added Harbhajan. Harbhajan dismissed Ponting to record his 300th Test wicket in 2008.

98.title: Bulgarian Police detain former PM Borissov after EU probes
98.article_body: Bulgarian former PM Boyko Borissov was detained on Thursday as part of a police operation linked to probes by the EU Public Prosecutor's Office, the Interior Ministry said. Prosecutors have opened 120 investigations of fraud in Bulgaria involving EU funds. Former Finance Minister Vladislav Goranov and former head of the parliamentary budgetary commission, Menda Stoyanova, have also been detained.

99.title: Sonali recreates old pics from 1998 film 'Duplicate' sets with Geeta
99.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share some pictures from the dance rehearsals of the song 'Tum Nahin Jaana' from her 1998 movie 'Duplicate'. The pictures also featured choreographer Geeta Kapur. Sonali also shared pictures of herself and Geeta recreating those old pictures on a reality show. "Circa 1996! So many memories come flooding back with these photos," she wrote.

100.title: AAP MLA from Punjab's Nabha cycles 80 km for swearing-in ceremony
100.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Punjab's Nabha (SC Reserve) Gurdev Singh Dev Mann cycled for 80 kilometres for his swearing-in ceremony as a legislator in Punjab Vidhan Sabha on Thursday. He travelled 80 kilometres one way from Nabha to Chandigarh on a cycle. Mann announced that he would take a token amount of ₹1 per month as an MLA.

101.title: Professor of law university in MP booked for sexually harassing 2 students
101.article_body: A professor of the National Law Institute University (NLIU) in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, who recently resigned over allegations of sexual harassment, has been booked for sexually harassing two students, police said. As per reports, the students have accused the professor of sending obscene messages and videos on their phones and asking them to meet him at his residence.

102.title: Nothing wrong with it: Arunoday on losing roles to more famous actors
102.article_body: Actor Arunoday Singh revealed that he has lost out on opportunities that went to bigger stars, adding that there's nothing wrong with it. Stating that the bigger stars make a project more viable, he said, "They give the project a bigger length." "That's how it works. That's my point. That's the natural way of the industry," Arunoday said.

103.title: No advantage for MI: Zaheer on IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai, Pune
103.article_body: MI's Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said there would be no advantage for the franchise with IPL 2022 being played in Mumbai and Pune, as MI won't be playing all their matches at Wankhede Stadium. Fifty-five league matches will be played at Brabourne Stadium, Wankhede Stadium and DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26.

104.title: What are MANPADS, the defence systems securing Ukraine?
104.article_body: MANPADS (Man-portable air-defence systems) are short-range surface-to-air missiles used to intercept fixed- and rotary-wing aircraft in flight. They are designed to be fired while mounted on a person's shoulder or a tripod. The US had already sent Ukraine more than 600 Stingers – a type of man-portable air defence system, amid the ongoing invasion by Russia.

105.title: Taliban to open high schools for girls next week, only female teachers for them
105.article_body: Taliban will allow girls in Afghanistan to return to class when high schools open next week, a Ministry of Education spokesperson said, months after uncertainty over full education access to girls. "There are some conditions for girls," he said, adding that female students would be taught separately from males and only by female teachers, except in areas where there's shortage.

106.title: AAP might pick Harbhajan, Chadha for Rajya Sabha from Punjab: Reports
106.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is likely to nominate Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha and IIT-Delhi Associate Professor Sandeep Pathak to the Rajya Sabha from Punjab, reports said. The elections to five out of the seven RS seats of Punjab will be held on March 31. "These are the three frontrunners for the three seats for now," said a source.

107.title: Film industry must also implement POSH Act: Kerala HC
107.article_body: The Kerala High Court asked movie production houses to form an internal complaints committee to deal with cases of women's sexual harassment, under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act of 2013 commonly known as POSH Act. An organisation with less than 10 female employees must make complaints to local complaints committee, the HC said.

108.title: Madrasa teacher arrested for sheltering terrorists at home in Bengal's Howrah
108.article_body: A madrasa teacher has been arrested for allegedly sheltering militants of banned terrorist group Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) at his rented house in Bankra in West Bengal's Howrah district. The accused has been sent to police custody for 12 days. The Special Task Force (STF) of the West Bengal Police is investigating if the accused was directly involved in terror activities.

109.title: Congress could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat: Congress' Tewari
109.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari has said the party could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat. "We lost in 2014 and 2019...Since 2014, out of 49 Assembly elections, we have lost 39 polls. We have only won four elections...therefore we are really looking at an extremely grim situation," he added. "The situation does not call for introspection alone," he further said.

110.title: 8 cyclones formed over 129 years in March, only 2 crossed coasts: IMD
110.article_body: Only eight cyclones have been formed in the month of March in over 129 years between 1891 and 2020, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Only two cyclones crossed the coast, one in 1926 and the other in 1907, IMD added. Of the eight cyclones, two have been formed in the Arabian Sea and six in the Bay of Bengal.

111.title: Dirty Russian tricks: UK Defence Min after a call from 'fake Ukraine PM'
111.article_body: UK Defence Minister Ben Wallace on Thursday ordered an inquiry after an imposter claiming to be the Ukrainian PM called him. The imposter "posed several misleading questions and after becoming suspicious I terminated the call", Wallace said. "No amount of Russian disinformation, distortion and dirty tricks can distract from Russia's human rights abuses and illegal invasion of Ukraine," he added.

112.title: Pune man arrested for killing labourer, dumping body on river bank
112.article_body: A 36-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing a labourer and dumping his body on banks of river Mula in Pune. Both of them worked together. "One of them had sold a phone to the other...A fight ensued over pending payment while they were consuming alcohol and the accused picked up a rock and smashed the other's head," police said.

113.title: 4 held for selling fake helicopter tickets to Mata Vaishno Devi pilgrims
113.article_body: Jammu Cyber Police with the help of Rajasthan Police arrested four persons for allegedly duping pilgrims under the name of providing helicopter tickets for Mata Vaishno Devi shrine through fake websites. After receiving complaint from Mata Vaishno Devi shrine board, police identified 40 fake ticket booking websites and tracked four fraudsters through their IP address who were operating from Kota.

114.title: Letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib during partition was a mistake: Shah
114.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, addressing an event organised by Land Ports Authority of India (LPAI), said letting Pakistan have Kartarpur Sahib gurdwara during partition was a "mistake" as it was just six kilometres away. "I don't know what went wrong. But when a festival of first Guru used to come along, there always was a feeling of sadness," he added.

115.title: Pant calmed down when close to fastest Test fifty causing his downfall: Hogg
115.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in India's Bengaluru Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pant calmed down while approaching the record causing his downfall. Pant was dismissed by Praveen Jayawickrama off the third ball after reaching the milestone. "All of a sudden, he was second guessing," added Hogg.

116.title: Don't want you to be broken like my dad who fought for Nazis: Arnold to Russian troops
116.article_body: In an appeal to Russian troops in Ukraine, actor Arnold Schwarzenegger said he doesn't want them to be "broken" like his father who fought for the Nazis during World War II. "My father...was...pumped up on the lies of his government. When he left Leningrad he was broken physically and mentally," he recalled. "This is an illegal war," Schwarzenegger stated.

117.title: India reports 2,528 COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries in the 24 hours
117.article_body: India has reported 2,528 new COVID-19 cases, 3,997 recoveries, and 149 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,539 cases and 60 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,281, while the active caseload declined to 29,181.

118.title: Nawab Malik's portfolios to be temporarily given to his colleagues: NCP
118.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) has decided to "temporarily" give charge of portfolios held by jailed Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik to his cabinet colleagues from the party in the next two to four days, NCP leader Jayant Patil said. "He'll continue to be a Minister. We're not taking his resignation," Patil added. Malik was arrested "in a wrong manner", he stated.

119.title: Never wanted any player to restrain: Kumble on KL Rahul's strike rate
119.article_body: Talking about ex-Punjab Kings captain KL Rahul who drew criticism for his strike rate while leading the franchise, PBKS head coach Anil Kumble said, "I don't think we ever wanted any player to restrain himself." Rahul batted at strike rates of 129.34, 138.80 in the two seasons when he led PBKS. He will lead Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2022.

120.title: Brother of IB staffer killed in Delhi riots gets state government job
120.article_body: Delhi government appointed Ankur Sharma, brother of Intelligence Bureau staffer Ankit Sharma, who was killed in northeast Delhi riots in February 2020, in the state's education department. Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal handed him over the appointment letter on Thursday. "We can never compensate...the loss...but I hope this...job and assistance of ₹1 crore brings the family strength," he tweeted.

121.title: It's been really scary: Justin Bieber on blood clot in wife Hailey's brain
121.article_body: Commenting on his wife Hailey Baldwin's recent medical emergency, singer Justin Bieber said, "It's been scary, you know, it's been really scary. But I know for a fact that God has her in palms of his hands, and that's a good thing." Earlier, Baldwin said she is "doing well" after experiencing stroke-like symptoms from a blood clot in her brain.

122.title: I-T dept makes highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22
122.article_body: The Income Tax department has made the highest tax collection in its history in 2021-22, according to CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra. The direct tax collection numbers for current financial year stand at ₹13.63 lakh crore as against over ₹9 lakh crore in 2020-21, he said. "The year-on-year net collections today is more by 48.4% over 2020-21," he added.

123.title: Urge India to speak out against Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine: US politicians
123.article_body: In a call with the Ambassador of India to the US Taranjit Singh Sandhu, US politicians Ro Khanna and Joe Wilson urged India to speak out against Russia President Vladimir Putin's targeting of civilians in Ukraine. "On both sides of the aisle, friends of India are urging India to use its influence for peace," Khanna tweeted.

124.title: Australian PM posts message on Holi, says 'Holi holds even more meaning this year'
124.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison posted a message on Holi and wrote, "Namaste to all my Indian Australian friends celebrating the Festival of Colours. I want to thank Indian Australian community for the love and care you have shown...to all Australians." "The ancient Festival of Colours gathers people together for a joyous celebration...Holi holds even more meaning this year," he wrote.

125.title: Kapil Sharma, Nandita Das meet Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik amid film shoot
125.article_body: Kapil Sharma and filmmaker Nandita Das met Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Thursday. Sharing some pictures from the meeting on Instagram, Kapil wrote, "It was a pleasure meeting the honourable CM of Odisha Shri Naveen Patnaik...Thank you for...making us feel at home. Your heart is as beautiful as your state." Kapil and Nandita are shooting for a film in Bhubaneswar.

126.title: US Senators introduce bill to ban imports of Russian uranium
126.article_body: US Republican Senators have introduced a bill to ban imports of Russian uranium in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Earlier, US President Joe Biden had announced a ban on Russian oil, gas, and energy imports. "Banning Russian uranium imports will further defund Russia's war machine, help revive American uranium production, and increase our national security," Senator John Barrasso said.

127.title: Madras HC rejects plea challenging O Panneerselvam's assembly win
127.article_body: The Madras High Court rejected a voter's plea which challenged AIADMK's senior leader O Panneerselvam's election from Bodinayakanur in last year's Tamil Nadu Assembly election. Petitioner alleged that Panneerselvam had "declared false income details in his election affidavit". The plea was rejected after Panneerselvam countered by stating that he had already "declared income details".

128.title: Behave politely with patients: Punjab health department to govt hospital staff
128.article_body: Punjab government's department of health and family welfare directed the staff of all government hospitals to behave politely with patients and maintain cleanliness in hospitals. Issuing the directions, Gurinder Bir Singh, Director, Health and Family Welfare, said, "Ensure availability of free medicine and tests for the patients...Wearing uniforms must be made mandatory for the hospital staff."

129.title: 4-yr-old girl dies after airgun misfires while playing at farmhouse near Hyd
129.article_body: A four-year-old girl died at a farmhouse in Telangana's Sangareddy district near Hyderabad after an airgun misfired, leading to a bullet injury on her head. Police have detained the owner of the farmhouse for negligence and the 17-year-old son of a watchman's relative for pressing the trigger while playing with the airgun.

130.title: UK to deploy Sky Sabre missile defence system to Poland amid Ukraine war
130.article_body: The UK will deploy its Sky Sabre medium-range anti-air missile system to Poland with about 100 personnel to strengthen the security of NATO's eastern flank, Defence Minister Ben Wallace said, amid the Ukraine war. This will help Poland "protect its airspace from any further aggression from Russia", Wallace added. Reportedly, Sky Sabre can launch missiles at speeds of 2,300 mph.

131.title: 7 held for operating fake angadia firm, cheating Mumbai businessman of ₹2 crore
131.article_body: Seven persons have been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly operating a fake angadia firm and cheating a city-based businessman of ₹2 crore. Angadia firms offer courier services to deliver money, jewellery and other valuables. The accused had allegedly taken the money from the businessman to deliver it to someone in Assam, but they did not do so, police added.

132.title: 2 Indian nationals detained at Delhi airport, 250 riflescopes recovered
132.article_body: Two Indian nationals were detained on Thursday at Delhi airport on their arrival from Bangkok. At least 250 pieces of riflescopes were recovered from their baggage. "Riflescope is a restricted item for import, and also attracts action under the Arms Act," a customs official said. CISF personnel on Wednesday caught three passengers travelling with forged documents at Delhi airport.

133.title: PM Modi, President Kovind extend greetings to nation on Holi
133.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday greeted the nation on the occasion of Holi. "May this festival of colours, a symbol of mutual love, affection and brotherhood, bring every colour of happiness in your life," PM Modi tweeted. "I wish that this festival infuses joy, enthusiasm...in the lives of all the countrymen," President Kovind said.

134.title: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets killed in Russian rocket attack
134.article_body: Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets has been killed in a Russian rocket attack on a residential building in Kyiv. Shvets had been awarded one of Ukraine's highest artistic honours. "Bright memory to the talented actress! There is no forgiveness for the enemy that has come to our land," her troupe, the Young Theater, said in a statement.

135.title: Putin is a murderous dictator, a pure thug waging an immoral war: Joe Biden
135.article_body: US President Joe Biden during an address for St Patrick's Day said Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a murderous dictator, a pure thug who is waging an immoral war against the people of Ukraine". He added that the US and Ireland are working together for the first time now and "Putin is paying a big price for his aggression".

136.title: 8 workers injured as fire breaks out at industrial scrap processing unit in Pune
136.article_body: Eight persons sustained burn injuries after a fire broke out at an industrial scrap processing unit in Pune's Moshi, where used oil barrels were being cleaned. Police claimed the incident took place when oil removed from the barrels came in contact with the flame of the furnace, which was being used to heat water. The unit's owner has been booked.

137.title: Lakshya Sen defeats world no. 3 Antonsen to enter All England quarterfinals
137.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen defeated world number three Anders Antonsen in straight games to reach the men's singles quarterfinals of the All England Championships on Thursday. Lakshya defeated Antonsen with a scoreline of 21-16, 21-18. Meanwhile, PV Sindhu and Saina Nehwal were knocked out after losing their respective women's singles' matches in the second round.

138.title: Real Madrid to donate €1 million to Ukrainian refugees
138.article_body: Real Madrid on Wednesday said they will donate €1 million to help Ukrainian refugees as part of their "Everyone with Ukraine" campaign, following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The club said the money will be donated to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the Red Cross. The UNHCR said nearly three million refugees have fled Ukraine so far.

139.title: Chinese 'manja' injures Black Kite; found hanging from tree in Agra
139.article_body: A juvenile Black Kite was injured by the Chinese 'manja' and was found hanging from a tree in Agra's Chhipitola. The bird was rescued by the Wildlife SOS Rapid Response Unit and is being currently kept under medical observation. "While the injuries are minor, the kite is unable to fly," said Dr Ilayaraja, Deputy Director, Veterinary Services for Wildlife SOS.

140.title: India & Sri Lanka sign agreement for a $1-billion line of credit
140.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) will provide a $1-billion credit facility to Sri Lanka for the procurement of food, medicines and other essential items, the Union Finance Ministry said on Thursday. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Sri Lankan Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa in Delhi. The ministers discussed wide-ranging issues, the ministry added.

141.title: Want diplomatic solution to Ukraine crisis, war must stop: Uzbekistan
141.article_body: Uzbekistan on Thursday called for a diplomatic solution to the Russian invasion in Ukraine, adding that it won't recognise Ukraine's breakaway regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent. Uzbek Foreign Minister Abdulaziz Kamilov said that while it wants good ties with both Russia and Ukraine, war "must stop immediately". Uzbekistan has also said it will provide humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

142.title: I am not in favour or against: Nadal on new tie-break system at GS
142.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he is "not in favour or against" the new 10-point tie-break when the score is 6-6 in the deciding set, which will be trialled at all four Grand Slams. "Well, I don't care much honestly. I honestly don't have a clear opinion," the 21-time Grand Slam champion said.

143.title: People only came to me with biopics after 'The Dirty Picture': Vidya
143.article_body: Vidya Balan revealed people only offered her biopics after her film 'The Dirty Picture'. "Meena Kumari, MS Subbulakshmi, Kiran Bedi...There were 10 of them that came to me at that time," she stated. Vidya, who had announced a web series on ex-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in 2018, was asked if it's still happening. To this, she replied, "I'd hope so."

144.title: 28-yr-old stabs father to death for objecting to alcoholism in TN
144.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested in Chennai on Thursday for allegedly stabbing his father, who used to scold him over his alcoholism and for not doing any work, police said. The accused stabbed his father after the two got into a heated argument on Wednesday night, according to the police. The accused was arrested from a hideout, police added.

145.title: Smoke from a huge fire at Walmart warehouse in US visible from space
145.article_body: A plume of smoke emitted from a huge fire at a Walmart distribution centre in Plainfield, US, was so vast that it could be seen from space on Wednesday afternoon, Bloomberg said. A clip posted on Twitter by National Weather Service gave a satellite's-eye view of the smoke spreading across the surrounding area. Twenty-four fire departments are fighting the fire.

146.title: Govt reacts as judge Bhandari votes against Russia, says 'voted in individual capacity'
146.article_body: On being asked about Indian judge Dalveer Bhandari's vote against Russia at International Court of Justice, Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "He happens to be an Indian national who's a member in his individual capacity on the ICJ." "I am not going to comment on how judges vote on issues that come to the ICJ," he added.

147.title: Man kidnaps & rapes minor girl in Delhi, arrested after shootout
147.article_body: A 28-year-old man was arrested for allegedly kidnapping and raping a minor girl in Delhi. According to the police, the accused fired at a team when they tried to arrest him on Thursday, and he sustained a bullet injury following an exchange of fire. The police received information about his movement on Thursday, said DCP (Outer-north) Brijendra Kumar Yadav.

148.title: Marriage was never part of my imagination: Actor Rahul Bose
148.article_body: Rahul Bose revealed that, at the age of 18, he had said that he'll never get married. "My mother said, 'That's ok, we will see five or ten years from now'. If she had been alive today, she probably would have realised that I just knew," he added. "Love, togetherness, companionships? Yes...But marriage...was never part of my imagination," Rahul stated.

149.title: Films should be made on Emergency & 'firing on Ram bhakts': BJP MP
149.article_body: BJP MP Mukesh Rajput on Thursday praised 'The Kashmir Files' and stated that movies should also be made on 1975-77 Emergency and alleged firing on Ram bhakts during ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's tenure. "People should know which CM and PM committed atrocities,” he said. 'The Kashmir Files' has revealed massacre of Kashmiri Pandits which was kept hidden, Rajput added.

150.title: Stress-free Kohli could be dangerous news for opposition: Glenn Maxwell
150.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has said that stress-free Virat Kohli could be dangerous news for opposition now that he won't be captaining the side. Maxwell added, "It is amazing for him to be relaxed a bit and actually enjoy the next few years of his career without any of that sort of external pressure."

151.title: Message to save water on Holi is cultural terrorism: MP minister
151.article_body: The message to save water on Holi is an attack on Hindu festivals and is cultural terrorism, Madhya Pradesh minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said. "How much water do we use during Holi? Save water throughout the year...Why does such a message revolve around our festivals only?" Sarang asked. He said the message was aimed at distancing youth from Hindu festivals.

152.title: Excitement level is 100 as 'Ek Villain Returns' shoot wraps up: Mohit
152.article_body: Director Mohit Suri has announced that the shooting of 'Ek Villain Returns' has been completed. Taking to Twitter, Mohit wrote, "The excitement level is 100 as 'Ek Villain Returns' wraps up...with Arjun Kapoor and Tara Sutaria." He further added that the movie will release on July 8 across theatres. The film is the sequel to the 2014 film 'Ek Villain'.

153.title: BSF personnel dance, sing 'Rang barse' on Holi eve; video surfaces
153.article_body: Personnel of the Border Security Force (BSF) posted in Jammu's Gajansoo area celebrated Holi by playing dhol and singing Bollywood songs. In a 0.52-second video that had surfaced on Twitter, the personnel can be heard singing Holi song 'Rang barse'. They also danced to the song and played with colours.

154.title: Form panels to stop harassment of women: Kerala HC to film bodies
154.article_body: The Kerala High Court on Thursday said that film bodies and production houses have the responsibility to form an Internal Complaints Committee (ICC), as per the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace Act, 2013. "It's only a question on the formation of it and it could be either done by the Producer's Association or the Chamber," said Producer Suresh Kumar.

155.title: Woman revenue official dies by suicide in MP; no suicide note found
155.article_body: A 30-year-old woman revenue official allegedly died by suicide in Bhedaghat of Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district on Thursday, police said. The incident came to light when she didn't respond to repeated knocks on the door of her house and could not be reached by neighbours, said Bhedaghat police station in-charge, Shafique Khan. No suicide note was recovered, he added.

156.title: Having gujiya was what I loved about Holi: Manushi Chhillar
156.article_body: Former Miss World Manushi Chhillar recalled celebrating Holi in her childhood and said, "I still remember having a small pink pichkari (water gun) going around with my friends, being very excited about Holi." She further added that having gujiya was what she loved about the festival. Manushi will mark her Bollywood debut with 'Prithviraj'.

157.title: AAP ended corruption in Delhi, Mann will end it in Punjab: Kejriwal
157.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that his government eradicated corruption in Delhi, adding that the new Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann will end corruption in the state as well. He also welcomed Mann's decision of releasing a WhatsApp number on March 23, for people to share recordings if government officials ask for bribes from them.

158.title: 40 gold biscuits worth ₹2.42 cr seized by BSF near B'desh border
158.article_body: The South Bengal Frontier of the Border Security Force (BSF) on Thursday seized 40 gold biscuits worth ₹2.42 crore from an alleged smuggler, who was trying to smuggle the gold from Bangladesh to India. According to reports, troops noticed the movements of a suspect, who, upon being confronted by a jawan, threw the bag and escaped towards Bangladesh.

159.title: 23-yr-old woman's burnt body found in Nagpur; petrol cans recovered
159.article_body: A 23-year-old woman's half-burnt body was recovered by the police from a secluded place in Nagpur's Surabardi on Wednesday and empty petrol bottles were found near the body of the deceased. Deputy Commissioner of Police (Zone I) Lohit Matani said that she had been missing since Tuesday and her family had filed a complaint at the Ranapratap Nagar police station.

160.title: Over 100 civilians rescued from theatre bombed by Russia: Reports
160.article_body: Over 100 civilians on Thursday were reportedly rescued from a theatre in Mariupol that was bombed by Russia on March 16. Ukrainian officials said thousands of people, including children, had sought refuge in the theatre. Officials said 79 children have died so far and over 100 have been injured since the invasion by Russia began on February 24.

161.title: BJP leadership will choose next Manipur CM: Thongam Biswajit Singh
161.article_body: Manipur BJP leader Thongam Biswajit Singh said on Thursday that the party leadership will decide who becomes the state’s next CM. "BJP is a democratic party...I think they will have a talk with all our legislators before a decision is made,” he added. Singh's comments come amid speculations of him being a front runner for the position.

162.title: ACB seizes over ₹27 lakh cash from PWD official accused of bribery
162.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has allegedly seized over ₹27 lakh cash from an engineer of the Public Works Department (PWD), booked in a bribery case in Maharashtra's Aurangabad district. Sanjay Patil, 52, was allegedly also caught accepting a bribe of ₹40,000 from a contractor on March 12. The ACB also found 183 gm of gold at Patil's house.

163.title: People throw slippers during Holi celebrations at Patna water park
163.article_body: People were seen hurling slippers and shoes at one another while playing Holi at a water park in Patna, a video of which surfaced on social media on Thursday. As per reports, the operators of the park repeatedly asked people to stop throwing slippers but they didn't listen. Subsequently, the authorities had to fire air guns to calm the people.

164.title: Russian soldiers made to say 'Putin is a di**head' after being captured
164.article_body: Russian soldiers captured by Ukrainian forces were forced to say "Putin is a di**head", a video of which has also surfaced online. They were also made to call Russian government  "scumbags". Dressed in military clothing and a black hat, one captive said, "I really love [my wife] and I hope that she will forgive me for coming here."

165.title: Bihar-born Dr Ashish Jha named White House COVID-19 response coordinator
165.article_body: US President Joe Biden has appointed Indian-American physician Dr Ashish Jha as the new White House COVID-19 response coordinator. President Biden said Jha is "one of the leading public health experts in America" and described him as the "perfect person for the job". The 51-year-old Bihar-born Jha said, "I'm deeply honoured for this chance to serve this country I love."

166.title: Engaged US couple diagnosed with cancer 8 days apart; prepones wedding
166.article_body: An engaged couple from the US, who were about to get married in June 2022, preponed their wedding to April 9 after both the partners were diagnosed with cancer. While 23-year-old Mariah Nelesen was diagnosed with ovarian cancer on January 11, 24-year-old Clay Slenk was diagnosed with Leukaemia eight days later. "There'll be a little more...sickness before health," Clay said.

167.title: Prithvi Shaw shares quote on 'karma' after reportedly failing Yo-Yo test
167.article_body: DC opener Prithvi Shaw took to Instagram Stories to share a quote on 'karma' after reports said that he failed a Yo-Yo test at a camp at the NCA in Bengaluru. "[Please] don't judge me when you don't know my situation, [you] are creating your own karma," the quote read. The 22-year-old batter last played for India in July 2021.

168.title: This looks superb and so inviting: Mahindra on pics of new highway in Manipur
168.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has praised a new highway built in Manipur. Retweeting a post by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari that featured a few photos of the Wangjing-Khonkhang section of NH-39 in Manipur, Mahindra wrote, "This looks superb and so inviting. The magic of Manipur is now much more accessible. These highways will knit India together even more tightly."

169.title: Bhagwant Mann celebrates Holi with Haryana CM, pics surface
169.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday celebrated Holi with his Haryana counterpart Manohar Lal Khattar at the Haryana Raj Bhawan in Chandigarh. The Raj Bhawan has shared pictures of the 'Holi Milan Samaroh'. Mann took oath as the Punjab Chief Minister at Khatkar Kalan, which is the ancestral village of Bhagat Singh, on Wednesday.

170.title: European Space Agency suspends joint mission to Mars with Russia
170.article_body: The European Space Agency (ESA) on Thursday said it has suspended the launch of ExoMars, its joint mission to Mars with Russia's space agency Roscosmos, over the invasion of Ukraine. "While recognising the impact of scientific exploration of space, the ESA is fully aligned with sanctions imposed on Russia by its member states," the ESA said.

171.title: China should take more effective measures: Xi amid rising COVID cases
171.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in the country, Chinese President Xi Jinping has urged the country to take more effective COVID-19 measures and minimise the impact of the epidemic on economic development, state television reported on Thursday. Millions of people in northeastern China are reportedly under lockdown as over two dozen regions have reported COVID-19 infections in the past few weeks.

172.title: OYO appoints Ankit Gupta as India CEO, Rohit Kapoor as global CMO ahead of IPO
172.article_body: IPO-bound OYO has elevated Ankit Gupta to the post of India CEO, while transitioning India and Southeast Asia CEO Rohit Kapoor will now work as the company's global Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). OYO's Southeast Asia operations will now be handled by global Chief Business Officer Ankit Tandon. This comes amid reports that OYO may slash its IPO valuation by half.

173.title: I've taken responsibility for Cong's U'khand poll defeat: Rawat
173.article_body: Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said he has taken responsibility for Congress' defeat in the Uttarakhand Assembly polls. "If I can't control mayhem in my own house (Congress), then I don't have the right to comment on BJP's CM face," Rawat said. He added that BJP coined the term 'Muslim University' and blamed him for religious polarisation.

174.title: Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD, CEO extended for 3 more months
