174.article_body: RBI on Thursday extended Rajeev Ahuja's term as RBL Bank interim MD and CEO for three more months with effect from March 25, the bank said. Ahuja was appointed as the interim MD and CEO on December 25 after former chief Vishwavir Ahuja's abrupt exit. In an unusual move, RBI also appointed an Additional Director on the bank's board.

175.title: Direct tax collection in FY22 stands at ₹13.63 lakh cr: CBDT chief
175.article_body: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said direct tax collection for FY22 outmatches revised estimates of ₹12.5 lakh crore after touching ₹13.63 lakh crore. He added that government's cumulative collection through tax deducted at source currently stood at ₹6.79 lakh crore and corporate tax collection stood at ₹7.19 lakh crore. "The numbers are more than what we expected," he said.

176.title: Anti-BJP alliance leader can only be chosen after LS polls: Yechury
176.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has said that the leader of an anti-BJP alliance can only be chosen after 2024 Lok Sabha elections and not prior to it. The front cannot be formed pre-polls given the diversity of India, Yechury stated. His remarks come amid ongoing efforts by Opposition leaders, including TMC's Mamata Banerjee, to forge alternate national front without Congress.

177.title: Daughter not entitled to father's money if she's unwilling to maintain ties with him: SC
177.article_body: While hearing a divorce case, the Supreme Court said that a daughter isn't entitled to any amount from her father for her education or marriage if she doesn't want to maintain any relationship with him. However, the court also said that it must be ensured that a sufficient amount is available with the mother to support the daughter.

178.title: Bhagavad Gita to be part of school syllabus for Classes 6-12: Gujarat govt
178.article_body: Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani said on Thursday that Bhagavad Gita will be part of the school syllabus for Classes 6-12 from the academic year 2022-23. "For students of Classes 6- 8, the scripture will be introduced in the textbook of...holistic education. From Classes 9-12, it'll be introduced in form of storytelling in textbook of the first language," he explained.

179.title: UN establishes formal ties with Taliban-run Afghanistan
179.article_body: The UN Security Council voted on Thursday to establish formal ties with Taliban-run Afghanistan, which is yet to be recognised globally. Ireland said that the resolution, which has been passed six months after the Taliban takeover, will address urgent needs of the Afghan people, support women's participation and protect human rights.

180.title: IDFC FIRST Bank's CEO gifts 5,00,000 shares to family of a deceased colleague
180.article_body: IDFC FIRST Bank's MD and CEO V Vaidyanathan has gifted 5,00,000 shares of the bank to family members of a deceased colleague. The deceased colleague was "closely known" to Vaidyanathan and the shares have been gifted to back the family's education and financial security, the bank said. Earlier, Vaidyanathan gifted shares to five people including his driver and househelp.

181.title: Doctor Strange isn't an Avenger, he's outside of that realm: Benedict
181.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch has said that Doctor Strange isn't an Avenger. "I'm not at Stark Tower with Nick Fury. No, he's sort of outside of that realm," Benedict added. He stated Doctor Strange is there to protect the reality of the Avengers in a different way. 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is expected to have cameos by MCU characters.

182.title: Kangana in talks with Vivek Agnihotri for his upcoming next: Report
182.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut is reportedly in talks with 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri for one of his upcoming projects. According to a source close to the development, "Vivek has been working on multiple ideas and...has discussed one of those with Kangana." "Talks are in very early stages...once they materialise, an official announcement will take place," the source added.

183.title: I've done favours for people in industry who lied to me: Shantanu
183.article_body: Shantanu Maheshwari, speaking about the entertainment industry, said, "People promise you, 'We'll work with you, [if] you do this as a favour'." However, added that they didn't live up to their word. Shantanu stated, "It feels like a betrayal because they promised certain things. So, why not live up to that promise?" Shantanu made his Bollywood debut with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'.

184.title: US Prez Biden to speak with Chinese Prez Xi over Ukraine crisis
184.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki has announced that the US President Joe Biden will hold a call on Friday with Chinese President Xi Jinping. Psaki said the call is part of ongoing US efforts to maintain open lines of communication between the two nations. "The...leaders will discuss managing...competition between our two countries [and] Russia’s war against Ukraine," Psaki added.

185.title: Liverpool beat Arsenal 2-0 to cut Man City’s lead in PL to 1 point
185.article_body: Liverpool on Wednesday beat Arsenal 2-0 to cut Manchester City's gap at the top of the Premier League to one point. Both Liverpool and Manchester City have played 29 games so far. Liverpool's victory was their ninth consecutive Premier League win. Diogo Jota and Roberto Firmino scored for Liverpool in the second-half. Arsenal play Aston Villa next on Saturday.

186.title: Need US' help to join NATO: Kosovo President amid Ukraine war
186.article_body: Kosovo's President Vjosa Osmani has written to her US counterpart Joe Biden, requesting him to use the US' "influence" in helping Kosovo join NATO amid Ukraine war. "We're exposed to persistent efforts by Russia to undermine Kosovo and destabilise the...Western Balkans," Osmani wrote. Notably, Russia doesn't recognise Kosovo as a sovereign country, which was earlier a breakaway province of Serbia.

187.title: Aston Martin's Vettel tests positive for COVID-19, to miss Bahrain GP
187.article_body: Aston Martin on Thursday announced that driver Sebastian Vettel has tested positive for COVID-19 and will miss the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix on March 20. The four-time Formula One world champion will be replaced by Aston Martin's reserve driver Nico Hulkenberg. Vettel is the second driver to test positive recently after McLaren's Daniel Ricciardo tested positive last week.

188.title: World no. 4 Nadal beats Opelka to reach Indian Wells quarter-finals
188.article_body: World number four Rafael Nadal on Wednesday beat Reilly Opelka 7-6(3), 7-6(5) to reach the quarter-finals of the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. The win extended Nadal's unbeaten run in the ATP Tour season to 18-0. "[Opelka] is one of the toughest opponents on Tour," Nadal, 35, said, who will now face Nick Kyrgios in the quarter-final.

189.title: McLaren F1 team announce multi-year partnership with Google
189.article_body: McLaren Formula One team on Wednesday announced a multi-year partnership with Google. The total value of the new deal is currently unknown. "We are absolutely delighted and proud to welcome Google to the McLaren Racing family," McLaren CEO Zak Brown said. The new partnership with McLaren will be Google's debut in Formula One.

190.title: OYO may slash its IPO size, expected valuation by half: Reports
190.article_body: IPO-bound OYO may slash its fundraising target of $1 billion by half or may even shelve the IPO launch altogether amid waning investor enthusiasm, Bloomberg reported. It's also considering halving its expected valuation from the $12 billion originally targeted. OYO had filed the draft red herring prospectus in September 2021 but is yet to get Indian market regulator SEBI's approval.

191.title: Political misfire: Ex-Guj CM Vaghela on giving Priyanka charge of UP
191.article_body: Former Gujarat CM Shankersinh Vaghela on Thursday said the decision to give Priyanka Gandhi Vadra charge of Congress in UP was a political misfire. He made the comments a day after attending the meeting of rebel Congress leaders. "G-23 isn't a revolt against the Congress...They just want to put forth concerns about the functioning of the party," he said.

192.title: Ukraine's youngest MP shares pics with girlfriend of 10 years killed in Russian shelling
192.article_body: Ukraine's youngest MP Sviatoslav Yurash took to Twitter to share pictures with his girlfriend, journalist Alexandra Kuvshynova, who was killed in Russian shelling. "Her I loved. Decade of happiness and sadness, joy and pain, meaning and loss. Only death could have parted us. Now I learn to hate. You shall never be forgotten. They shall never be forgiven," he wrote.

193.title: Audience will witness several twists in 'Bloody Brothers': Jaideep
193.article_body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat, speaking about his upcoming web series 'Bloody Brothers', has said that the audience will witness several twists and turns in the show. "They will keep wondering what is happening and as the secrets of each character keep unravelling, the audiences definitely will be hooked on the show," he added. The show also features Zeeshan Ayyub.

194.title: Was offered Pegasus spyware 4-5 yrs ago for ₹25 cr, rejected offer: Mamata
194.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee claimed on Thursday that Israeli cyber intelligence company NSO had approached the state police department four-five years ago to sell their Pegasus spyware for ₹25 crore. "I turned it down as it could have been used politically...which is not acceptable," she said. Banerjee has repeatedly accused BJP-led Centre of using Pegasus for spying on opponents.

195.title: 15-20 Indians still in Ukraine who want to get evacuated: MEA
195.article_body: As per the Indian government's assessment, there are still 15 to 20 people stranded in Ukraine who want to get evacuated, MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Thursday. He said, "We'll see that a way to evacuate them comes out." Bagchi added that over 22,500 Indians have been evacuated from Ukraine so far.

196.title: Hindustan Petroleum buys 2 million barrels of Russian crude oil: Report
196.article_body: The Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd has bought two million barrels of Russian crude oil, PTI reported on Thursday. This comes after reports claimed that the Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) bought 3 million barrels of crude oil from Russia at a steep discount. IOC reportedly bought Urals crude for May delivery at a discount of $20-25 a barrel to dated Brent.

197.title: Punjab Kings launch their new jersey, share pic
197.article_body: Punjab Kings (PBKS) have launched their new jersey ahead of the upcoming season of IPL. PBKS have not made many changes to their jersey and have retained their red and golden colours. IPL 2022 will begin on March 26, while PBKS will face RCB in their opener on March 27. PBKS had finished sixth in IPL 2021.

198.title: Lithuanian Parliament urges UN to impose no-fly zone over Ukraine
198.article_body: Lithuanian Parliament has unanimously adopted a resolution urging the UN to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine amid Russian invasion. "The...no-fly zone would...ensure the security of humanitarian corridors," the resolution read. Additionally, it called for democratic countries to impose more sanctions on Russia and Belarus and an expedited EU candidate country status for Ukraine, reports stated.

199.title: SP fields doctor Kafeel Khan for UP Legislative Council polls
199.article_body: Samajwadi Party has fielded Gorakhpur paediatrician Dr Kafeel Khan for upcoming Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council polls from Deoria-Kushinagar seat. The paediatrician at Gorakhpur's Baba Raghav Das (BRD) medical college was terminated from service by UP government last year. He was among the accused in the 2017 hospital tragedy in which over 60 children died due to disruption in oxygen supply.

200.title: 'Our soil not fit to run bullet train,' says Nusrat; Minister calls remark 'shameful'
200.article_body: During her speech in Parliament, actress-turned-politician Nusrat Jahan said Indian soil wasn't fit to run bullet trains. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw called her claim "shameful" and said, "We should have full faith in our engineers and our capabilities." The TMC MP later tweeted, "It's the Science...not to be taken as one speech of a street corner meeting."

201.title: Nauman Ali's 18-ball 0* more crucial than my 104*: Muhammad Rizwan
201.article_body: Pakistan batter Muhammad Rizwan said spinner Nauman Ali's unbeaten 0 off 18 balls in the second innings of Pakistan's Karachi Test against Australia was more crucial than his 104*. "His compact batting gave me confidence," added Rizwan. "When [Nathan] Lyon came to bowl...I thought only about survival. By God's grace I got...boundaries and got to a hundred," added Rizwan.

202.title: 60 passengers escape unhurt after bus catches fire in MP's Betul
202.article_body: Nearly 60 passengers on board a bus in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district escaped unhurt after it caught fire on Wednesday night. The Hyderabad-bound bus caught ablaze on a national highway, after which the passengers deboarded the vehicle and a fire tanker was called to douse the flames, police added. A probe is underway to ascertain the cause of the fire.

203.title: We are very disappointed with India's stance on Russia's invasion of Ukraine: UK minister
203.article_body: Britain is very disappointed with India's stance on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, UK's Trade Minister Anne-Marie Trevelyan said. Asked if India's stance would impact trade talks with Britain, Trevelyan said, "We're very disappointed, but we continue to work with Indian partners and hope that their views will change." "India is an incredibly important trading partner for the UK," she added.

204.title: Ellen DeGeneres to give staff more than ₹15 crore in bonuses
204.article_body: American television host Ellen DeGeneres will reportedly pay her staff more than ₹15 crore in bonuses, with the final episode of her talk show 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show' set to air on May 26. Ellen had announced in May 2021 that her talk show would end in 2022, having run for 19 seasons. "It's...not a challenge anymore," Ellen had said.

205.title: I think Kapil Sibal should be expelled: Cong leader TS Singh Deo
205.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister and Congress leader TS Singh Deo on Thursday said former MP Kapil Sibal should be expelled from Congress and that he should form his own party. This comes after Sibal said that the Gandhi family should step down and let others lead Congress. "I think tolerance is the reason for the weakness of Congress party," Singh said.

206.title: Won't take pension as ex-MLA, use it for people's welfare: Parkash Badal
206.article_body: Former Punjab CM and SAD patriarch Parkash Singh Badal has decided to not take the pension as a former MLA and asked the Punjab government to use it for the welfare of the people of Punjab. "Formal request in writing being sent separately," he said. A five-time Punjab CM, Badal lost his first Assembly election since 1969 from Lambi.

207.title: WhatsApp scam uses fake download links of 'The Kashmir Files', people lose ₹30 lakh
207.article_body: Cybercriminals are sending fake movie download links of 'The Kashmir Files' to WhatsApp users to scam them, police have warned. Malware is installed on the users' phones when they click the fake link and it steals the users' bank details, the TOI reported. A Noida police official said three people approached the police with similar complaints after losing ₹30 lakh.

208.title: Have no info right now: MEA on Chinese foreign minister's India visit
208.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Thursday he has no information at the moment about Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi's visit to India. The clarification came amid reports that Yi could visit India later this month. If he arrives in India, it would mark the first visit by a senior Chinese leader amid Indo-China tensions.

209.title: Kim Kardashian says boyfriend Pete got her name branded on his chest
209.article_body: Kim Kardashian has revealed that her boyfriend Pete Davidson got her name branded on his chest. "Pete got this because he wanted to do something different. He wanted to get something...he cannot get removed or cover-up," she stated. "The [other tattoos] are cutesy ones. My favourite one...says 'My girl is a lawyer' and that one is really cute," Kim added.

210.title: People thought 7 is my lucky no., I chose it as it's my date of birth: MSD on jersey no.
210.article_body: Talking about his jersey number seven in a recent interaction, CSK captain MS Dhoni said, "A lot of people initially thought 7 is my lucky number and all of that." He added, "But I chose it for a very simple reason. I was born on July 7. So it's the seventh day of the seventh month, that was the reason."

211.title: Russia's Sputnik V vaccine review delayed by WHO over Ukraine war
211.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday said it has delayed the review of Russia's COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V over the country's invasion of Ukraine. "We were supposed to go do inspections in Russia on March 7, and these inspections were postponed for a later date," WHO Assistant Director-General for Access to Medicines and Health Products Mariangela Simao said.

212.title: Help came too late: Ukraine's Zelenskyy in address to German MPs
212.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday virtually addressed the German parliament for the first time, saying that "help came too late to stop war", following Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. "You're still protecting yourself behind a wall that does not make it possible for you to see what we are going through," he added.

213.title: US to give Switchblade drones to Ukraine to target Russian military
213.article_body: US administration will provide Switchblade drones as part of a military aid package to Ukraine for fighting Russia. The military officials described Switchblade drones as 'kamikaze drones" as they can be flown directly at a target and explodes after hitting the target, a report stated. Reportedly, the US secretly sent these drones to Afghanistan in 2010 for use against Taliban.

214.title: Ireland PM Martin tests positive for COVID-19 during US visit
214.article_body: A senior administration official on Wednesday said Ireland's Prime Minister Michéal Martin learned he tested positive for COVID-19 while attending an event with US leaders that included President Joe Biden. Martin was attending the Ireland Funds 30th National Gala in Washington ahead of planned St. Patrick's Day celebrations on Thursday.

215.title: UK among 6 nations to request UN Security Council meeting on Ukraine
215.article_body: The UK permanent mission to the UN on Wednesday said six nations - the UK, US, France, Albania, Ireland and Norway - have requested a meeting of the UN Security Council on the situation in Ukraine. "Russia is committing war crimes and targeting civilians. Russia's illegal war on Ukraine is a threat to us all," the UK mission said.

216.title: Man teaches helmet's role using watermelon, Hyd Police shares video
216.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday shared a video to spread awareness about the role of helmets. In the video, a man can be seen teaching his son the importance of wearing a helmet while riding a two-wheeler with an example of a watermelon. "Wear a helmet when riding a two-wheeler," the police captioned the video.

217.title: Taxi driver sets himself on fire in UP alleging police harassment
217.article_body: A 26-year-old taxi driver set himself on fire inside the Kotawali Gauriphanta police station campus in Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday, alleging he was harassed by the police and four other men. According to the police, the victim alleged that the four men and the police used to extort money from taxi drivers. The victim suffered over 80% burn injuries.

218.title: Car thief who messaged police 'catch me if you can' held in B'luru
218.article_body: A man who allegedly stole over 40 cars across at least nine different states was arrested in Bengaluru. Rajasthan-based Satyendra Singh Shekhawat, who allegedly stole luxury cars and SUVs by using smart gadgets to generate duplicate keys, had challenged police by saying, "catch me if you can." The 41-year-old MBA degree holder was also arrested in 2003.

219.title: We encourage Indian leaders to work closely with us to stand up against Putin: US
219.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Thursday said, "We remain in touch...with leaders in India and continue to encourage leaders to work closely with us to stand up against President Putin's invasion of Ukraine." This comes as US President Joe Biden called Russian President Vladimir Putin a "war criminal" and offered $800 million worth of new weaponry to Ukraine.

220.title: Recognise Putin as war criminal: Ukraine minister to EU lawmakers
220.article_body: Ukrainian Minister Oleksii Reznikov has asked European Union (EU) lawmakers to recognise Russian President Vladimir Putin as a war criminal. Reznikov, in his appeal, mentioned Russian bomb shelling on a theatre in Mariupol on Wednesday, which was sheltering over 1,000 people. Notably, US President Joe Biden has called Putin a war criminal, which Kremlin termed "unforgivable".

221.title: PM Modi speaks to South Korea's President-elect, vows to deepen ties
221.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday spoke to South Korean President-elect Yoon Suk-yeol and congratulated him on his victory in the recently held Presidential elections. PM Modi said, "It was a pleasure to speak with...Yoon Suk-yeol. We discussed the potential of further deepening the India-Korea Special Strategic Partnership in many areas." The South Korean Presidential elections were held on March 9.

222.title: Delhi Police details plan to ensure safe Holi, Shab-e-Barat
222.article_body: Delhi's DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan on Thursday said 17 pickets have been placed on roads heading towards New Delhi to ensure intense checking on Holi and Shab-e-Barat. "We've...kept two drones with night vision to keep an eye in the Jama Masjid and Delhi Gate areas," Chauhan said. "Sufficient forces will be deployed. We'll also deploy outside forces," she added.

223.title: Decide on inclusion of Rajbhar community in ST list: HC to UP govt
223.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has asked the Uttar Pradesh government to decide within two months on the inclusion of the Bhar/Rajbhar community in the list of Scheduled Tribes. At present, the community has been given the status of OBC. The court gave the order on a writ petition filed by the Jago Rajbhar Jago Samiti and another on March 11.

224.title: Was truly pampered: Mrunal on working with Ishaan, Priyanshu in Pippa
224.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, speaking about working with Ishaan Khatter and Priyanshu Painyuli in her upcoming film 'Pippa', has said that working on the film felt like she was around her family. Mrunal added that she was "truly pampered" on the set. "These bonds have surely been formed for life. I hope that reflects on screen," she further said.

225.title: Ukrainian mother of 12 killed on front line of war with Russia
225.article_body: Olga Semidyanova, a 48-year-old combat medic, was killed in battle with Russian Armed Force on the front line of war. Olga had been a military medic since 2014 in the Donetsk region. "Olga Semidyanova was awarded the Mother-Heroine status as a mother of six children and six more adopted," Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

226.title: Man seeks ₹3 cr in bitcoins for Nawab Malik's release, case filed
226.article_body: Maharashtra minister and senior NCP leader Nawab Malik's son Aamir Malik has lodged an FIR with Mumbai Police after a man allegedly demanded ₹3 crore in bitcoins to get his father out on bail. The accused had sent an email to him. "I've lodged the FIR, but can't share more about it as it is a confidential matter," he said.

227.title: Police sends drone to hunt down history-sheeter hiding in pond in Tamil Nadu
227.article_body: The Tenkasi District Police in Tamil Nadu sent a drone to hunt down a history-sheeter who went into hiding in a pond after assaulting the public. The police drone spotted history-sheeter Shahul Hameed hiding in the marshy water. After the drone spotted him, the police surrounded him from all sides and subsequently arrested him.

228.title: He's an absolute legend: Ranveer on father-in-law Prakash Padukone
228.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that his father-in-law Prakash Padukone puts on a show when the latter picks up a badminton racquet. "He'll stand in one place and make you run the entire court," Ranveer added. The actor further said that Prakash has got almost saint-like energy. "He's an absolute legend...I...treasure all the life lessons...he teaches us," Ranveer stated.

229.title: PMC to install 11 sewage treatment plants to clean Mula-Mutha River
229.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to increase its sewage treatment facility to treat domestic sewage discharged in the Mula-Mutha River. The civic body plans to install 11 sewage treatment plants to bridge a treatment gap of over 200 MLD. It aims to improve the water quality and ecology by ensuring no untreated sewage water is released into the river.

230.title: NATO starts military drills in Norway amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
230.article_body: NATO has started "massive" military drills in Norway amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Around 30,000 troops, 220 aircraft and 50 vessels from 27 countries are participating in NATO's "Cold Response" 2022 drills. Meanwhile, an official from the Norwegian Joint Headquarters said the military drills were planned months in advance and is in no way linked to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

231.title: Delhi Police appoints 82 legal consultants to improve probe
231.article_body: Delhi Police said that they have hired 82 legal consultants across different districts and in units like the crime branch and special cell to assist investigating officers and to improve the quality of the probe. Officials on Thursday said that the consultants will improve investigation in important cases, help in registering FIRs efficiently and help in training new recruits.

232.title: Honduran judge grants US' extradition request for ex-Prez Hernández
232.article_body: A Honduran judge on Wednesday authorised the extradition of ex-President Juan Orlando Hernández to the US to face drug trafficking and weapons charges. "We're going to file an appeal to try to avoid extradition," Hernández's lawyer said. Hernández, who was arrested last month, has been accused of being involved in a narco-trafficking scheme, accepting bribes and abetting use of weapons.

233.title: Paytm's target price slashed to ₹450 by Macquarie citing 'tough times ahead'
233.article_body: Macquarie has cut its target price for Paytm's parent company One97 Communications Ltd shares by about 36%, to ₹450 apiece, as it sees "tough times ahead" for the company. "With the RBI raising issues with Paytm Payments Bank and Chinese ownership being over 25%, the probability of Paytm getting a small finance banking licence is significantly lower now," Macquarie said.

234.title: Zero COVID-19 patients in Delhi's LNJP Hospital for 1st time in 2yrs
234.article_body: Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital on Thursday saw zero COVID-19 admissions for the first time since March 2020, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. LNJP Hospital Medical Director Dr Suresh Kumar said the last two COVID-19 patients were discharged on Wednesday. "Salute to the entire medical fraternity for their dedicated service," Jain added.

235.title: Delhi Police arrest 11 under 'Operation Hifazat' to curb street crime
235.article_body: The South District Police on Tuesday arrested 11 suspects in six different cases under 'Operation Hifazat', which has been launched to curb street crime in Delhi, senior officers said. Deputy Commissioner of Police (south) Benita Mary Jaikar said in six separate operations, two bootleggers, seven gamblers and two criminals carrying illegal knives were arrested.

236.title: 5 of DDA's 6 new sports facilities to be in Dwarka
236.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) is developing six sports facilities in Delhi, of which five will be located in Dwarka, including a golf course. The complexes will be located in sectors 17, 8, 19, 23 and 24, where the golf course is proposed. The construction of the ₹45-crore golf course is almost 26% complete, a senior DDA official said.

237.title: Sandeepa posts old home's pic after watching Kashmir Files, says 'family escaped in truck'
237.article_body: After watching 'The Kashmir Files', actress Sandeepa Dhar wrote, "The day they announced Kashmiri Pandits should leave their women behind and leave Kashmir, my family [fled] their homeland, hidden in...truck." She added her family is experiencing PTSD from having to relive it and thanked Vivek Agnihotri for "showing the truth". Sandeepa also shared a picture of their old home.

238.title: BMW modified, fitted with machine gun by Ukrainians to fight Russia; video viral
238.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, a video of a modified BMW 6 Series car with a heavy machine gun mounted on it in Ukraine has gone viral on social media. The weapon mounted in the car's trunk is Soviet-era NSV 12.7X108mm, according to reports. The video shows the car painted in the colours of Ukrainian flag.

239.title: Bhupinder Hooda meets Rahul, day after attending rebel leaders' meet
239.article_body: Former Haryana CM and senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Thursday met former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi, claimed reports. A day earlier, Hooda had attended the meeting of rebel leaders of Congress, to discuss the party's situation after the poor performance in polls. Reportedly, Hooda visited senior party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad after meeting Gandhi.

240.title: Many people in Russia are showing themselves to be traitors: Kremlin
240.article_body: Many people in Russia were showing themselves to be "traitors", Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Thursday, pointing at those "leaving their jobs" and "moving to other countries". His comments came a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia is undergoing a "natural and necessary self-cleansing" as people were able to "distinguish the true patriots from the scum and...traitors".

241.title: Thanks Shahid for making these 6 months fun: Ali post wrapping shoot
241.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar has said that the shooting of his upcoming film, which features actor Shahid Kapoor, has been completed. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Thank you, Shahid, and the entire team for making these last six months super fun." The untitled film is reportedly an adaptation of a French action thriller, 'Nuit Blanche'.

242.title: Taiwan to launch locally made satellites in 2026: Minister
242.article_body: Taiwanese Science and Technology Minister Wu Tsung-tsong has said the country could launch locally made satellites from its territory in 2026, a report stated. Tsung-tsong said he hoped the construction of the satellite's base could start in 2024 and by 2025, it would be completed, the report added. The ministry is reportedly looking for a site for the satellites' launch.

243.title: Meta to allow parents to track their kids' Instagram time globally
243.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta will allow parents to track how much time their children are spending on Instagram globally soon. The Instagram supervision tools will roll out globally over the coming months, Meta said. Parents will also be able to see what accounts their children follow and set time limits for their kids to spend on the app.

244.title: Remove real culprit or Cong will be haunted in 2024 and beyond: Sunil Jakhar
244.article_body: Days after Congress chief Sonia Gandhi sacked party chiefs of five states including Punjab, senior leader Sunil Jakhar said, "A sham 'witch-hunt' will not help. Show courage. Censure and remove the real culprit from high positions." "Otherwise, this ghost of religion/caste/identity politics will haunt the Congress party in Punjab even in 2024 and beyond," he added.

245.title: India's 1st vaccine to protect lions against CDV in clinical trial stage
245.article_body: The clinical trials for India's first indigenously-produced vaccine against Canine Distemper Virus (CDV) have begun. The vaccine, developed by Gujarat Biotechnology and Research Centre (GBRC), has shown over 80% efficacy according to initial results, a state government official said. The virus is reported to have killed 30 lions at Gir National Park in Gujarat in 2018.

246.title: India managed Omicron surge much better than other countries: Centre
246.article_body: India's COVID-19 vaccination drive helped the nation to manage Omicron surge better than other countries, Lav Agarwal, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said. "Today...15-17 lakh cases are being reported globally but India is reporting around 3000 daily cases," he said. India has administered over 180 crore vaccine doses which is 3.2 times more than US, he added.

247.title: 2 men from Bihar arrested in Mumbai for possessing charas worth ₹1 cr
247.article_body: Two men from Bihar were arrested in Mumbai for possessing 3 kg of charas worth ₹1 crore. The accused were arrested on Tuesday in Goregaon (east) when they had arrived to deliver the contraband, an official said. "During the probe, it was found that the accused were involved in supplying contraband in different parts of...country," zonal DCP Somnath Gharge said.

248.title: Govt orders aggressive genome sequencing as COVID cases rise in Asia, Europe: Report
248.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has directed officials to aggressively carry out genomic sequencing as COVID-19 cases are rising again in some Asian and European countries, reports said. The two-hour-long meeting was attended by the head of India's COVID-19 task force Dr VK Paul, AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria and ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava among other people, reports added.

249.title: Crypto produces 17 'known' billionaires worldwide: Hurun Rich List 2022
249.article_body: Cryptocurrency has produced 17 "known" billionaires worldwide, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. The pack of 17 billionaires is led by Changpeng Zhao, the CEO of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance. He's followed by Bahamian cryptocurrency exchange FTX's CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Brian Armstrong, the CEO of Coinbase, is the world's third-richest crypto billionaire.

250.title: Vaccination drive a testament to India's capabilities: Mansukh Mandaviya
250.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya said India's vaccination drive that produced affordable vaccines for Indians and exported them to over 150 countries is a testament to India's capabilities. He also thanked health workers, NGOs for working tirelessly throughout the pandemic. "Management of COVID-19 pandemic...has strongly demonstrated to the world the power of...self-reliance," he added.

251.title: Guj govt schools to teach English from Class 1 instead of Class 3
251.article_body: Gujarat government schools will now teach English as a subject from Class 1 instead of Class 3 from the new academic session starting June 2022, state Education Minister Jitu Vaghani announced on Thursday. "Gujarati is mandatory and important but English will be taught to Class 1 and 2 students too," he said. The minister was speaking in the state Assembly.

252.title: Do you support this bloody war, SAP: Ukraine Vice PM on video of Russian attack
252.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov tweeted a video showing the destruction in the country amid Russia's attack and wrote, "Do you support this, SAP? Or you can stop your support?" Fedorov alleged, "After 21 days of bloody war, German company SAP continues technically supporting its Russian clients - Gazprom, Sberbank, Rosatom and others." "This money murders Ukrainian children!" he added.

253.title: My son is happy that I'm working: Sonali on judging 'Dance India Dance...'
253.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, who is currently judging the reality show 'Dance India Dance Li'l Masters' season 5, years after being diagnosed with cancer, spoke about her son's reaction to her working after long. She said, "He's very happy that his mother is working and is out of his hair now. He'd be saying that 'it's good that mom is busy'."

254.title: I'm really excited: Viay on working with Kareena in Sujoy Ghosh's next
254.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who recently announced a new project with Sujoy Ghosh, said he's really excited to share screen space with actors Kareena Kapoor Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat. He added, "I had been waiting to tell the world about it." "Not only is the script so amazing but also the kind of team [I'm getting] to work with," Vijay said.

255.title: Instagram bans Kanye for 24 hrs over racial post against Trevor Noah
255.article_body: Instagram has banned US rapper Kanye West for 24 hours for violating its policies on hate speech, bullying and harassment. Kanye had directed a racial post at talk show host Trevor Noah after he said Kanye was harassing his former wife Kim Kardashian. The rapper responded by replacing some of 'Kumbaya' song lyrics with a racial slur against Black people.

256.title: Over 19 lakh people have entered Poland from Ukraine since war began
256.article_body: More than 19,50,000 people have entered Poland from Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24, Chancellery of the PM of Poland said on Thursday. Around 60,000 people had entered the country from Ukraine on Wednesday alone, it added. According to the UN refugee agency, more than 30 lakh people have now fled Ukraine to escape the war.

257.title: Reform, perform, transform to next level: PM to trainee civil servants
257.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed the valedictory function of the 96th Common Foundation Course at Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration, Mussoorie. Speaking to the IAS trainees, he urged them to focus on the "biggest goal of the 21st century" Atmanirbhar Bharat and Modern India. He further asked them to "reform, perform and transform to the next level".

258.title: I wish to be a suicide bomber to blow up opposition: Pakistan minister
258.article_body: As Pakistan PM Imran Khan faces no-confidence motion, Pakistan Minister Ghulam Sarwar Khan said, "Although suicide bombing is forbidden, I wish to be a suicide bomber to blow up the entire opposition." Voting on the no-confidence motion is slated to take place between March 26 and 30, with Imran Khan saying the opposition's motion is going to fail.

259.title: Majority of people say they thought I would be like a sexbot: Bella Hadid
259.article_body: American model Bella Hadid said, "The majority of the time when I meet people, they say, 'I...didn't think you...[would] be nice, that you were going to be...some kind of a sexbot." "For three years while I was working, I would wake up...hysterical, in tears alone," added Bella. "I was on this calorie-counting app which was like the devil," stated Bella.

260.title: Pankaj denies doing Pawan Kalyan's film, says 'Hope to work with him soon'
260.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi dismissed the reports that he will be a part of Pawan Kalyan's film 'Bhavadeeyudu Bhagat Singh'. He said, "Reading the news of doing a film with Pawan Kalyan on social media made me really happy...But as much as I want this news to be true, unfortunately, it's not. But I...hope I get to work with him someday."

261.title: Speechless, moved to tears: Zoe Saldana on watching 20 minutes of 'Avatar 2'
261.article_body: Sharing her experience on watching 20 minutes of 'Avatar 2' which is the sequel to 2009 film 'Avatar', actress Zoe Saldana who starred in the original film said, "I was speechless. I was moved to tears." "I can get choked up just talking about it," added Saldana. 'Avatar' is among the highest-grossing movies of all time.

262.title: RR have got the 2 best spinners in IPL in Ashwin, Chahal: Sangakkara
262.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said the franchise have got the two best spinners in the IPL in Ravichandran Ashwin and Yuzvendra Chahal. "We have secured depth in every department," added Sangakkara. Ashwin has taken 145 wickets in 167 IPL matches with Chahal picking 139 wickets in 114 matches.

263.title: BJP leader Pravin Darekar granted protection from arrest till Mar 21
263.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra Legislative Council Leader of Opposition Pravin Darekar has been granted protection from arrest by a Mumbai court till March 21. Darekar's anticipatory bail plea will be heard on March 21. He had filed the bail application regarding an FIR registered against him for fraudulently contesting a cooperative bank election in the 'labour' category.

264.title: Robot-assisted surgery in Delhi helps man shed diapers after 24 yrs
264.article_body: A 24-year-old Yemenese man suffering from a congenital defect called Extropy Epispadias Complex was operated in a robot-assisted surgery in Delhi which has enabled him to shed diapers he was using for 24 years. In this condition, the lower abdominal wall does not develop at all, leaving the bladder open with urine draining out from the open abdomen, doctors said.

265.title: Twitter account of Statistics Ministry briefly hacked, name changed to Elon Musk
265.article_body: The official Twitter handle of the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation briefly appeared to be hacked on Thursday. Hackers changed the account's display name to Elon Musk and display photo to that of the Tesla CEO and posted several tweets on Musk's timeline. This comes months after Information and Broadcasting Ministry's Twitter account was hacked.

266.title: Taiwan inseparable part of China, don’t equate it with Ukraine: Chinese envoy
266.article_body: Chinese ambassador to the United States Qin Gang called against equating Taiwan with Ukraine, saying that while the latter is a sovereign state, the former is an inseparable part of China's territory. "We hope the United States earnestly abides by the one-China principle and does not support 'Taiwan independence' separatism in any form," he added.

267.title: Kejriwal gives govt job to brother of IB staffer killed in Delhi riots
267.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday gave an appointment letter for a government job to Ankur Sharma, the brother of Intelligence Bureau staffer Ankit Sharma who was killed in the 2020 Delhi riots. Ankur has been posted in the Education Department of the Delhi Government. "We can't compensate for...loss of a loved one...[but] this...job...will be of immense help," Kejriwal tweeted.

268.title: Sceptics wondering ‘Even that's possible': 'Gangubai...' producer on its success
268.article_body: Jayantilal Gada, who is one of the producers of Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' said, "People didn't expect much from the film. Now that the [film's]...successful, the sceptics are...wondering, 'Ok, even that's possible'." Gada is also one of the producers of the upcoming film 'RRR', which stars Ram Charan, Jr NTR. "The film will generate...greater...craze than 'Baahubali'," added Gada.

269.title: The Hundred draft postponed to avoid clash with Shane Warne's state funeral
269.article_body: The draft for the second edition of 'The Hundred' has been rescheduled to avoid a clash with the state funeral of Shane Warne, who passed away on March 4 after a heart attack. The draft, originally scheduled on March 29, will now be held on April 5. Warne will be given a public farewell at MCG on March 30.

270.title: 519 fishermen from Gujarat imprisoned in Pakistani jails: Minister
270.article_body: As many as 519 fishermen from Gujarat were imprisoned in jails in Pakistan till December 2021, Minister of State for Fisheries Jitubhai Chaudhari said. Pakistani authorities apprehended 163 and 195 fishermen in 2020 and 2021 respectively. As many as 247 fishermen are in Pakistani jails for one year, 76 for three years and one for over five years, Chaudhari added.

271.title: Ukraine claims 14,000 Russian soldiers killed; 444 enemy tanks destroyed
271.article_body: Ukraine on Thursday claimed that it has killed around 14,000 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. It further estimated that 444 Russian tanks, more than 190 aircraft have been destroyed by their military. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 1435 armoured personnel carriers, 201 artillery systems, and 72 multiple launch rocket systems.

272.title: Russia rejects UN court's order to immediately stop Ukraine invasion
272.article_body: Kremlin has rejected the order to immediately stop the invasion of Ukraine by United Nations' top court, International Court of Justice. "We cannot take this decision into account," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. He added that both parties, Russia and Ukraine, had to agree for the ruling to be implemented. "No consent can be obtained in this case," Peskov said.

273.title: Consumers could lose invested money if they buy crypto assets: EU
273.article_body: The European Union's securities, banking and insurance watchdogs in a joint statement warned that consumers risk losing all their money invested in cryptocurrency assets and could fall prey to scams. "Consumers should be alert to the risks of misleading advertisements, including via social media and influencers," the authorities said. They also mentioned energy consumption by some assets.

274.title: Experiencing PTSD, family left Kashmir with sister hidden under seat: Sandeepa
274.article_body: Actress Sandeepa Dhar took to social media to share that 'The Kashmir Files' has made her family experience PTSD (Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder). "My family decided to flee their homeland...hidden in back of truck...with my young cousin sister hidden under seat behind my father's feet for safety," she said, adding that the film is a "punch in the gut" for her.

275.title: Man gets 20 years in jail for planting bomb at K'taka's Mangaluru airport
275.article_body: A court on Wednesday sentenced a man to 20 years in jail under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act for planting a bomb near the departure gate of Karnataka's Mangaluru International Airport. An unattended bag was found near the gate on January 20, 2020, which was later defused by a bomb squad. Mangaluru Police had filed the charge-sheet in June 2020.

276.title: 175 terrorists killed, 183 captured in last 1 year in J&K: CRPF chief
276.article_body: Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) DG Kuldiep Singh said the paramilitary force killed 175 terrorists and captured 183 in Jammu and Kashmir since March 1, 2021. He added that 1,500 terrorists and Maoists were arrested and 750 others were forced to surrender in 2021-22. With 246 battalions and over 3.15 lakh personnel, CRPF is world's largest paramilitary force, Singh said.

277.title: Pic shows tumbler removed from woman's bladder in Tunisia; was used for 'erotic purpose'
277.article_body: Doctors removed a glass tumbler from a woman's bladder in Tunisia after she went to them complaining of urinary tract infection (UTI). A scan of the woman's bladder had revealed a large bladder stone with a glass encased. "The patient disclosed this happened while she was using an intra-vaginal foreign body (glass) for erotic purposes 4 years ago," doctors said.

278.title: AAP moves SC against postponement of Delhi civic polls, seeks orders for SEC
278.article_body: AAP has approached SC seeking directions for the state Election Commission to conduct municipal elections in Delhi in a free, fair and expeditious manner without the interference from Centre. The plea was filed after the commission deferred polls as the Centre planned to merge three municipalities of Delhi. AAP claimed Centre was attempting to buckle the state Election Commission's independence.

279.title: 6 Japanese doctors reach Hungary to treat refugees from Ukraine
279.article_body: A team of six Japanese doctors and other medical professionals has arrived in Hungary to assist refugees from Ukraine and provide them with aid. The professionals, who are working with Hungarian doctors in border town of Zahony, are reportedly associated with non-governmental bodies in Japan. Ukrainians are facing many hardships, we want to provide them support, a Japanese medic said.

280.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police shares video of man hit by bike on busy road
280.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Thursday posted a video of a road accident in the city. The video shows a man on a bike being hit by another bike on a busy road, following which the traffic police comes to their rescue. "Who is at fault?" police captioned the video. It often posts such videos to spread awareness on road safety.

281.title: Punjab CM announces anti-corruption helpline; complaints to be lodged via WhatsApp
281.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has announced that an anti-corruption helpline will be launched on freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's Shaheedi Diwas on March 23. People of the state will be able to lodge complaints regarding corruption via WhatsApp. Earlier in the day, Mann said, "A very big decision will be taken today in the interest of the people of Punjab."

282.title: Ukraine says Qualcomm inadvertently aiding Russia, firm calls it 'incorrect'
282.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov urged Qualcomm to end its operations and supplies in Russia, adding, Qualcomm products are "inadvertently" enabling Russia to kill Ukrainians. Qualcomm's Senior VP Nate Tibbits said the firm is complying with US sanctions and is not selling products to Russian companies. "Qualcomm has called for peaceful resolution to the aggression," Tibbits said.

283.title: B'luru Police launches helmet campaign in memory of Puneeth Rajkumar
283.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police has launched a campaign in honour of late actor Puneeth Rajkumar to raise awareness about the role of high-quality helmets in saving lives. Puneeth's wife, Ashwini Puneeth Rajkumar, inaugurated the campaign and distributed helmets to women traffic personnel. A video, which showed Puneeth urging people to follow traffic rules and wear helmets, was also released by police.

284.title: Loan sharks blackmail woman with morphed image in Mumbai, case filed
284.article_body: An FIR has been lodged at Mumbai's Parksite police station after a 39-year-old woman claimed that loan sharks allegedly blackmailed her saying they would upload her morphed obscene picture if she doesn't repay the loan. She had repaid ₹8,000 in February but the accused kept demanding more money. Later, she received a WhatsApp message carrying her morphed image.

285.title: Heat wave to severe heat wave warning issued for 9 states/UTs over 2 days, list released
285.article_body: IMD issued heat wave to severe heat wave warning for nine states and UTs over two days. Heat wave to severe heat wave conditions are very likely to prevail in parts of Rajasthan and Gujarat on March 17 and 18. Further, heat wave conditions are likely over Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Jammu & Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh.

286.title: Stunning: Twinkle as Asha Parekh features on cover of Harper's Bazaar magazine
286.article_body: Akshay Kumar's wife, author Twinkle Khanna reacted as veteran actress Asha Parekh featured on the cover of Harper's Bazaar India magazine. Taking to Instagram, Twinkle wrote, "How stunning is this picture! Asha Ji is magnificent." In the picture, Asha is seen donning a black pullover with a statement pearl necklace.

287.title: The only question is match readiness of Dhoni, Rayudu, Uthappa: Irfan
287.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said the only question for CSK ahead of the upcoming IPL season is the match readiness of MS Dhoni, Ambati Rayudu and Robin Uthappa. "CSK picked players [in the auction] from their champion team of 2021...who are match-winners on their own," added Irfan. CSK will face KKR in IPL's opener on March 26.

288.title: Delhi Metro services delayed on 3 lines; office-goers affected
288.article_body: Services on Delhi Metro's Violet, Pink and Green lines were delayed on Thursday morning, affecting office-goers. An official said the delay was due to a technical snag and it was resolved later. Commuters took to Twitter to comment on the delay. A passenger said, "You heard about work from home and work from office...now you can see work from metro."

289.title: Maharashtra govt imposing restrictions on Hindu festivals: BJP MLA
289.article_body: Maharashtra government is imposing restrictions on Hindu festivals, BJP MLA Ram Kadam said. This comes after the Maha Vikas Aghadi government announced restrictions ahead of Holi. "Why is MVA resorting to such extreme steps?" Kadam added. Maharashtra government announced guidelines for Holi mandating celebrations should end by 10 pm and banned the use of loudspeakers.

290.title: Who are the world's 10 richest people & what are their net worths as per Hurun?
290.article_body: Tesla's Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $205 billion wealth, according to the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List. He's followed by Jeff Bezos with $188 billion wealth and LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault with $153 billion wealth. Bill Gates is the 4th richest person and he's followed by Warren Buffett and Google Co-founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page.

291.title: Extra step non-striker takes might end up destroying your career: Ashwin to bowlers
291.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, in a message for bowlers regarding 'mankading' dismissal being shifted from 'unfair play' to 'run-out' section in MCC rule book, urged bowlers to not have "second thoughts" on running non-strikers out. He added, "Extra step the non-striker is taking might end up destroying your...career. If...non-striker ends up on strike because of that extra step...he might smash a six."

292.title: 4 family members of ex-village pradhan killed over land dispute in UP
292.article_body: Four family members of a former pradhan at Rajapur Gungawachh village in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi district were killed over a land dispute which was going on for a long time with a relative. Four persons have been arrested in connection with the alleged murder, police said. The pradhan had dumped building materials on the disputed land, police added.

293.title: We have the power to put all of our brash enemies in their place: Russia
293.article_body: Deputy Secretary of Russia's Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, has said that country has the power to put "all of its brash enemies in their place". Medvedev, who served as President from 2008 to 2012, added that the US had stoked "disgusting" Russophobia in an attempt to force Russia on its knees and then rip it apart.

294.title: Kohli said 'You may be talking to wrong person': Karthik on request to consider him for RCB
294.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik recalled his chat with Virat Kohli last year, revealing that he had "slipped in" a request to consider him for RCB in the mega auction. "I slipped it into him and he said, 'You might be talking to the wrong person, bro!'" Karthik added. Karthik was bought by RCB for ₹5.5 crore.

295.title: UAE cargo ship with 30 crew members including Indians sinks, 28 rescued so far
295.article_body: A United Arab Emirates cargo ship sank off the coast of Iran with 30 crew members including Indians aboard, authorities said. Rescuers saved 16 crew members, the captain said. Another 11 had made it onto a life raft, while one person was saved by a nearby tanker. Two crew members were still in the water, he added.

296.title: Sensex ends 1,047 points higher at 57,864, logs best week in over a year
296.article_body: The Sensex jumped 1,047 points on Thursday to close at 57,864 following gains in global markets, a day after US Federal Reserve's first interest rate hike in over three years. The Nifty 50 jumped 312 points to end at 17,287. HDFC and Reliance Industries were among top gainers. The Sensex and Nifty logged their best week in over a year.

297.title: PM's pic on 'The Kashmir..' tickets will spread hate faster: Minority body
297.article_body: Dr J Aslam Basha, Chairman of the Minority Department Tamil Nadu Congress Committee, took to Twitter to say that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should pass a law to print his picture on tickets of 'The Kashmir Files'. "The hate will spread much faster," his tweet added. PM Modi had earlier said campaign is being run to discredit the film.

298.title: Bringing outside shoes inside home is health hazard: Scientists
298.article_body: Wearing shoes in the house is just plain gross and a potential health hazard, scientists who study indoor contaminants have warned. Some of the microorganisms present on shoe bottoms are drug-resistant pathogens that are very difficult to treat. Moreover, they also consist of cancer-causing toxins from asphalt residue on roads as well as endocrine-disrupting lawn chemicals, the researchers found.

299.title: Reliance, Ola Electric win bids under ₹18,100 cr PLI scheme: Reports
299.article_body: Reliance Industries and Ola Electric will receive incentives under Centre's ₹18,100 crore Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme to boost local battery cell production, Reuters reported. Hyundai Motors and Indian jewellery maker Rajesh Exports have also won the bids. Ola Electric and Hyundai will get incentives for 20 Gwh capacity while Reliance and Rajesh Exports have won incentives for 5 Gwh.

300.title: 119 batteries worth ₹6.7 lakh stolen from Pune godown
300.article_body: Pune Police have registered a case against an unknown person for stealing 119 batteries worth ₹6.7 lakh from a godown in city's Khadki area. The batteries were reportedly stored inside a barbed compound, however, the accused managed to enter the premises and steal them. "We have leads and will soon arrest people...These are batteries used in broadband modems,” police said.

301.title: 'Doesn't he own a suit?' says US millionaire on Zelenskyy's speech outfit; criticised
301.article_body: US millionaire and financier Peter Schiff criticised Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's outfit for virtual address to US Congress. "I understand times are hard, but doesn't the President of the Ukraine own a suit...I wouldn't want to disrespect the institution or the United States," he tweeted. Schiff was widely criticised for his remarks, with a user calling it the "dumbest thing".

302.title: 188 cases of custodial death in Gujarat in 2 years: CM Bhupendra Patel
302.article_body: As many as 188 cases of custodial death were reported in Gujarat in the last two years, the state government said in response to a question raised by a Congress MLA. CM Bhupendra Patel added that 88 incidents of custodial death took place in 2020 and 100 in 2021. FIRs were lodged and departmental inquiries were initiated, the government stated.

303.title: If I like a singer's song, I buy it: Akshay on being called a mini T-Series
303.article_body: Akshay Kumar spoke about his reputation as 'mini T-Series' in a recent interview ahead of the release of his film 'Bachchhan Paandey'. He said, "Whenever I like a song by a new music director or...singer, I acquire it." "I keep them with me and when it fits in a particular situation in a movie, I use them accordingly," he added.

304.title: Harmanpreet needs to bat higher up in Women's WC: Edulji
304.article_body: Ex-India captain Diana Edulji has suggested Harmanpreet Kaur, who has scored a century and a fifty in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, to bat at number three instead of her usual number five position in upcoming games. "Opening pair (Smriti and Yastika) is fine...Deepti [at number four], and Mithali can control the innings at five," Edulji explained.

305.title: Toyota plans to make 8 lakh vehicles per month amid chip shortage
305.article_body: Toyota is planning to produce an average of 8 lakh vehicles per month globally in the April-June quarter due to the global chip shortage. Earlier, Toyota had announced plans to cut output in Japan by 20% in April, 10% in May and 5% in June. The firm said its production is operating as normal, but won't help recover lost output.

306.title: Shiv Sena MP demands reducing fare of Mumbai AC local trains
306.article_body: While speaking in the Lok Sabha recently, Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale called for reducing the fare of AC local trains in Mumbai. He claimed few passengers travel by AC trains. "As a solution to this, if the Railways reduce the fares of AC locals, then the ridership will increase and there will be no loss," he said.

307.title: Prostitution racket busted in Chennai spa, two held
307.article_body: Chennai police have arrested two men on the charge of running a prostitution racket at a spa in one of the busiest areas of the city. Three women were rescued. According to the police, they received information that a few people were forcing young women, who came to the city in search of jobs, into prostitution.

308.title: Investors ₹19 lakh cr richer as Sensex adds over 5,000 points in 8 sessions
308.article_body: The Sensex added more than 5,000 points and the Nifty50 gained over 1,400 points in the last eight sessions in a row, barring the March 15 trading, making investors ₹19 lakh crore richer, Moneycontrol reported on Thursday. On Thursday itself, investors' wealth increased by ₹4 lakh crore. This comes amid positive global cues, easing commodity prices and declining volatility.

309.title: Russia frees abducted Ukraine mayor in exchange for 9 conscript soldiers
309.article_body: Russian forces freed the Mayor of Ukraine's Melitopol city in exchange for nine of their captured conscript soldiers, a spokeswoman of the head of Ukraine's President's Office said. Russian soldiers exchanged had all been born between 2002-2003, "practically children", Daria Zarivna added. Following the release, Ivan Fedorov thanked Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy for "not abandoning" him.

310.title: Priest misbehaves with girl under pretext of counselling in Kerala, held
310.article_body: Police have arrested a 34-year-old priest in Kerala for "misbehaving" with a 17-year-old girl who was taken to his residence for counselling. The next day he went to the girl's house and repeated the behaviour. The girl reportedly told her friend about incident who in turn informed the school authorities. Police said that priest will be produced before a court.

311.title: 3 morning walkers killed, 1 injured after lorry mows them down in Kerala
311.article_body: Three senior citizens, who went for a morning walk, were killed in the Alappuzha district of Kerala on Thursday after being mowed down by a speeding lorry. Another person, who was also with them, suffered critical injuries and was admitted to a nearby hospital, police said. The vehicle and its driver were later taken into custody, police added.

312.title: Shops shut in B'luru as Muslim clerics call for bandh over hijab verdict
312.article_body: A few shops were shut in some areas of Bengaluru after Muslim clerics called for a day-long bandh in Karnataka to protest against the High Court's verdict on hijab. Shop owners reportedly said they would "bear this loss of business for the sake of their rights". Karnataka HC on Tuesday upheld the ban on wearing hijab in state's educational institutions.

313.title: Assam Police recover weapons, warlike stores from passenger bus
313.article_body: The Assam Police on Thursday recovered weapons and warlike stores from a bag in a passenger bus in the Karbi Anglong district of the state. The police along with the troops of Assam Rifles had intercepted the bus near Bokajan. "The owner of the bag had not boarded the bus," Bokajan Sub Divisional Police Officer (SDPO) said.

314.title: Video shows cobra striking man as he performs stunt, IFS officer says 'Horrific'
314.article_body: IFS officer Susanta Nanda shared a video of a cobra striking a Karnataka man as he performs stunt with three snakes. He can be seen pulling at their tails and moving his hands. "This is just horrific way of handling cobras...The snake considers the movements as threats and follows the movement. At times, the response can be fatal," wrote Nanda.

315.title: Meta removes more Russia posts calling kid's hospital bombing a hoax
315.article_body: Meta's Facebook has removed more official Russian posts that claimed reports of Russia bombing a children's hospital in Ukraine were fake. The misinformation reportedly circulated on Russian Embassy's Twitter, Facebook and Telegram accounts after the platforms took down several posts by the embassy in the UK.

316.title: 10 CRPF personnel died by suicide so far this year, says chief
316.article_body: CRPF DG Kuldiep Singh has said that 10 personnel have died by suicide so far in 2022. "We are taking various steps to address mental stress including organising 'Chaupal' where personnel share their problems and we try to solve them," he said. "If we are unable to solve it, then we take it to the professionals," he added.

317.title: Remove flexes from Pune Metro pillars, punish offenders: BJP leader
317.article_body: BJP leader Sandeep Khardekar has sought the removal of banners and flexes from Pune Metro pillars. "Instead of just removing these flexes and boards, Maha Metro should [also] take legal action...against the wrongdoers,” Khardekar wrote to Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and Maha Metro rail officials. The Pune Metro Rail commenced its operations on March 6.

318.title: Garbage catches huge fire in Pune, smoke seen from several kilometres
318.article_body: Garbage accumulated in a canal near Pune's Pulgate area caught a huge fire on Wednesday, resulting in dense smoke that was seen from a distance of several kilometres. No person was injured and no damage reported, an officer said. He added that it was a huge fire and it took about half an hour to bring the situation under control.

319.title: School teacher runs away with minor girl student in Odisha; arrested
319.article_body: A private school teacher from Odisha's tribal-district Sundargarh was arrested for allegedly running away with one of his minor students studying in Class 8. According to police, the teacher, who was also the girl's Math tutor, entrapped her into a relationship and eloped with her. He was caught by Kutra police team in Bihar's Siwan district after her father's complaint.

320.title: Moody's slashes India's FY22 GDP growth estimate from 9.5% to 9.1%
320.article_body: Moody's has slashed India's GDP growth estimate for FY22 from 9.5% to 9.1%. According to the rating agency, the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war is expected to cost India a high fuel and fertiliser import bill in FY22, leading to reduced government spending and a reduction in India's GDP growth. Moody's has projected India's year-end inflation at 6.6% in FY22.

321.title: Used to be rackets & strings, now this: Ukraine tennis star Alex on pic of gun, army gear
321.article_body: Ukrainian tennis star Alex Dolgopolov has shared a picture of military gear and an assault rifle on Twitter amid war with Russia. "Used to be rackets and strings, now this," he wrote with the picture. "I'm back, to help with what I can and defend our home," he wrote in another tweet.

322.title: DRDO constructs 7-storey building in record 45 days for developing fighter jets
322.article_body: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has constructed a seven-storey FCS Complex in record 45 days in Bengaluru. The building would be used as the R&D facility for the indigenous development of fifth-generation Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA). Defence Minister Rajnath Singh inaugurated the FCS Complex in Bengaluru on Thursday.

323.title: Pakistan's performance was probably best-ever in match-saving cause: Raja
323.article_body: Praising Pakistan for their performance in the second Test against Australia, which ended in a draw, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said their batting was probably the best-ever in a match-saving cause. "Babar Azam probably played the best innings of his life," he added. Babar scored 196 runs while Mohammad Rizwan remained unbeaten at 104 runs in their second innings.

324.title: Species of frog believed to be mute chirps first time in 100 years
324.article_body: Ecuadoran biologist Jorge Brito discovered a toad belonging to the Rhinella festae species chirping in the forest while trekking. The brown frog species characterised by its rough skin and prominent nose was believed to be mute ever since it was discovered 100 years ago. Brito took the toad to a laboratory and found it could sing without a vocal sack.

325.title: Bengaluru student dies by suicide after lecturer rejects his project record
325.article_body: A 20-year-old student from Bengaluru studying hotel management in Mangalore died by suicide allegedly after his lecturer rejected his project record and told him that he would not be allowed to sit for an exam. The student has been identified as B Bharath. In a police complaint, Bharath's father has accused the lecturer and college chairman for his son's death.

326.title: Doglapan chodo: Ashneer to BharatPe board on 'making crores with T20 WC passes' allegation
326.article_body: Ashneer Grover responded to the allegations of making crores of rupees by selling free passes during ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2021, by tweeting, "Board waalo yeh sab Doglapan chodo." He also shared a picture from the tournament, and wrote, "What I am actually doing is ensuring Suhail Sameer (CEO) and Sumeet Singh don't drink silly the hospitality section dry."

327.title: India has world's 3rd highest number of self-made billionaires: Hurun
327.article_body: As per the 2022 M3M Hurun Global Rich List, India ranks third in the list of self-made billionaires with 119 such individuals. These individuals have cumulative wealth of $474 billion. China has the most number of self-made billionaires at 1,050, with $3.756 trillion combined wealth, while the US stands second with 523 self-made billionaires, whose combined wealth is $3.554 trillion.

328.title: Ukraine war's impact on fossil fuel prices will boost renewables: German minister
328.article_body: German minister Patrick Graichen has said the impact of Russia-Ukraine war on fossil fuels will boost the means needed to curb climate change. "The core technologies to become independent of (Russian President Vladimir) Putin and to drive forward climate protection are the same," he said. "They are renewables, efficiency and electrification. These will get a massive boost," he added.

329.title: UP ends all COVID-19 curbs, allows weddings at 100% capacity
329.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Thursday released an order, underlining that all COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted in the state amid dipping cases. The order said weddings and other events can take place at full capacity of the venue while following coronavirus-appropriate behaviour. Water parks and swimming pools can reopen and Anganwadi centres can resume functioning, the order read.

330.title: If Putin is afraid to fight, I'll use only my left hand & I'm not left-handed: Musk
330.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to "single combat" amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, tweeted, "If he (Putin) is afraid to fight, I will agree to use only my left hand and I am not even left-handed." Musk tweeted this after Putin's ally Ramzan Kadyrov told Musk, "Don't measure your strength against that of Putin's."

331.title: Noida-Greater Noida Metro services to start after 2 pm on Holi
331.article_body: The Noida-Greater Noida Metro services will be available from 2 pm on the occasion of Holi on Friday. The parking facility at Noida Sector-51 station will also be available from 2 pm. "Normally on working days, NMRC metro trains services start from 6 am," Noida Metro Rail Corporation (NMRC) Managing Director Ritu Maheshwari said.

332.title: Tennis player who defeated Federer seen carrying Kalashnikov rifle amid Russia attack
332.article_body: Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky who defeated Roger Federer in the second round at Wimbledon in 2013 has taken up arms amid Russia's attack on the country. Stakhovsky was seen patrolling the Maidan Square, armed with a Kalashnikov rifle and a pistol in his belt. "I'm not sure how I am going to react to shooting at somebody," he said.

333.title: Bhagwant Mann unfurls new anti-mafia era in Punjab: Navjot Singh Sidhu
333.article_body: A day after resigning as the Punjab Congress chief, Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday said, "Bhagwant Mann unfurls a new anti-mafia era in Punjab with a mountain of expectations." "The happiest man is the one from whom no one expects…hope he rises to the occasion, brings back Punjab on the revival path with pro-people policies…best always," Sidhu tweeted.

334.title: Mahatma Gandhi Green Triangle inaugurated in Madagascar
334.article_body: Ambassador of India to Madagascar, Abhay Kumar inaugurated a Green Triangle named after Mahatma Gandhi along with Mayor of Antananarivo Naina Andriantsitohaina to mark the Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav on Wednesday. At the ceremony, Kumar said the initiative highlights Gandhi's vision and philosophy when it comes to reducing consumerism, respecting nature and aiming for sustainable development.

335.title: B'luru Police arrests 4 for dacoity bid, seizes machetes & daggers
335.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru City Police on Thursday arrested four persons who were reported to be preparing for dacoity in the city. The crime branch has also seized long machetes and daggers from the possession of the accused persons. Police have registered a case against them at VV Puram Police Station and launched an investigation into the matter.

336.title: boAt launches its first "Made In India" smartwatch, Wave Pro 47
336.article_body: boAt has launched its first "Made in India" smartwatch, Wave Pro 47 with 1.69" HD display. The smartwatch features a square dial with 500 nits of brightness. With IP67 waterproofing and dust resistance, Wave Pro 47 has up to 7 days of battery life, multiple sports modes, real-time SpO2 monitor, live cricket scores, and customized fitness plans.

337.title: ₹59 cr allotted for Southern Railways, ₹13,200 cr for Northern Railways: DMK MP
337.article_body: DMK MP Kanimozhi has claimed that the budget allocated for Southern Railways towards new lines in 2022-23 is ₹59 crore, whereas the budget allocated for Northern Railways is ₹13,200 crore. She has asked the Union Railway Minister to look into the disparity. "Pointed out the discrimination...in the allocation of funds between South and North India," Kanimozhi tweeted.

338.title: Was kicked out of 13 films, refused to do their films now: Vidya Balan
338.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that she was earlier replaced in 13 films and that she now gets calls from the producers who replaced her. "In the recent times, I have received calls from them (producers who earlier replaced her in their films) but I politely refused to be part of their films," she said.

339.title: Shouted 'don't kill my people'; forgot it was acting: The Kashmir Files actor
339.article_body: The Kashmir Files actor Bhasha Sumbli, who's also a Kashmiri Pandit, revealed that it was emotionally traumatising to relive the brutal massacre in the film. She said, "Vivek sir had cast Kashmiri Pandits there. When they were being shot with bullets, I started shouting...'don't kill my people'." "I had forgotten that acting was happening...I had a panic attack," she added.

340.title: Russian forces stealing food, evicting civilians: Ukraine's Sumy Oblast Guv
340.article_body: Governor Dmytro Zhyvytsky of Ukraine's Sumy Oblast has claimed that the Russian forces are evicting the civilians from their homes and stealing food. Zhyvytsky reportedly gave details about the looting through Telegram on Wednesday. Earlier, reports of Russian troops surviving merely on onions, potatoes and pickles had surfaced after Ukrainian forces seized a battlefield kitchen.

341.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine has largely stalled on all fronts: UK
341.article_body: UK's Ministry of Defence, in the latest Defence Intelligence update on Ukraine situation, said that the Russian invasion of Ukraine has largely stalled on all fronts. "Russian forces have made minimal progress on land, sea or air in recent days and they continue to suffer heavy losses," it added. "The vast majority of Ukrainian territory...remains in Ukrainian hands," it stated.

342.title: Musk to exit Miss Universe owner Endeavor's board, firm says 'he has little time'
342.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk will resign from the board of directors of Endeavor, with effect from June 30, 2022. "We know he has a lot of demands and little time and we appreciate the support he provided us," the company said. Endeavor owns the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) and the Miss Universe pageant.

343.title: Relationship was initially consensual, says Delhi HC as it grants bail to rape accused
343.article_body: Granting bail to a rape accused, the Delhi High Court said it cannot be ignored that he "has clean past antecedents" and that the nature of the relationship between the parties "was initially consensual and went sore". According to the complaint, the accused would pressurise the woman to continue with the relationship and threaten to commit suicide and kill her.

344.title: Indian-origin Miss World runner-up Shree overcame facial burns, Instagram post goes viral
344.article_body: An Instagram post of Shree Saini, the Indian-origin Miss World 2021 runner-up, revealing she suffered burns after a car accident, has gone viral. Sharing a video, she wrote, "I was in a major roll over car accident that left my face with bleeding wounds. I no longer had my face. I couldn't even recognise myself."

345.title: iPhone-maker Foxconn to work under COVID-19 bubble in China: Report
345.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn plans to work under COVID-19 bubble arrangement at its Shenzhen campus in China to resume production until at least Sunday, Reuters reported citing an internal document. The firm has arranged for some staff to live and work in a bubble. Foxconn's major production for iPhone reportedly occurs in Zhengzhou, while only a small part occurs in Shenzhen.

346.title: Lifetime achievement award: Hillary Clinton thanks Russia for sanctions
346.article_body: After Russia imposed sanctions on Hillary Clinton, the former US State Secretary tweeted, "I want to thank the Russian Academy for this Lifetime Achievement Award." Russia on Tuesday had unveiled sanctions against several US political figures, including Clinton and President Joe Biden, in retaliation to US sanctions on Russia over Ukraine war. Clinton and Biden are banned from entering Russia.

347.title: ED issues summons to TMC's Abhishek Banerjee, wife in coal scam case
347.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued fresh summons to Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Abhishek Banerjee and his wife for questioning in connection with the alleged coal scam in West Bengal.
