Abhishek and his wife have been asked to depose before the investigation officer next week, officials said. This comes after Delhi HC dismissed their plea challenging the summons issued by ED.

348.title: Sri Lanka asks citizens to limit fuel, power consumption amid inflation
348.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has asked the citizens to limit the consumption of fuel and electricity amid protests over rising inflation in the country. "By limiting the use of fuel and electricity, the citizens can extend their support to the country," Rajapaksa said. He added that the government has asked the International Monetary Fund to allow deferring loan repayments.

349.title: IPS officer's bag found to be fully filled with peas at Jaipur airport; pic goes viral
349.article_body: IPS officer Arun Bothra has shared a picture showing a bag full of peas on Twitter. "Security staff at Jaipur airport asked to open my handbag," Bothra, who is Transport Commissioner of Odisha, wrote along with the picture. The picture shared by Bothra has gone viral with over 50,000 likes.

350.title: Pune woman books cake online, loses ₹65,191 to cyber fraudster
350.article_body: A woman in Pune lost ₹65,191 to cyber fraudster after she was made to share her bank details after booking a cake online. The woman shared an OTP that she received, after which the money was debited in five transactions. Police have booked unidentified fraudster under Sections 419 and 420 of Indian Penal Code and sections of Information Technology Act.

351.title: India will face challenge in 5 of their remaining 7 WTC Tests: Saba Karim
351.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said India are likely to face challenges in five of their remaining seven Tests in the ongoing World Test Championship cycle. "India will face challenge in the only Test that's going to be played in England and the four against Australia [at home]," he added. Apart from these, India will tour Bangladesh for two-Test series.

352.title: Sanitation workers' fatalities reduced to 24 in 2021: Centre
352.article_body: The number of fatalities due to cleaning of hazardous sewers and septic tanks has come down in the country, Union Minister Ramdas Athawale informed the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. The number of such deaths reduced to 24 in 2021 compared to 118 in 2019, he said. He further informed that a national policy for mechanised sanitation eco-system has been prepared.

353.title: 3 Panama-flagged ships hit by Russian missiles in Black Sea
353.article_body: Three Panamanian-flagged ships have been hit by Russian missiles in the Black Sea since Russia invaded Ukraine last month, Panamanian authorities said. One ship sank but others remain afloat with damages, Noriel Arauz, Panama Maritime Authority administrator, said. At least 10 other Panama-flagged ships are in the Black Sea, Arauz added, saying the Russian Navy is restricting them from leaving.

354.title: Learn from Indian curators how to prepare turners: Aaqib Javed to PCB
354.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said the PCB should learn from Indian curators how to prepare turning tracks. "I am surprised until now Pakistan has not been able to produce pure turning tracks, which will help our spinners," added Javed. The pitches for Pakistan's two Test matches played so far at home against Australia have drawn criticism.

355.title: Islamic Centre of India urges mosques to alter Friday prayer timings amid Holi
355.article_body: The Islamic Centre of India has urged mosques to change the timings for Friday prayers amid the festival of Holi. Further, with Shab-e-Barat also falling on the same day, it asked Muslims to visit mosques and graves of their loved ones after 5 pm. Notably, 22 mosques have pushed the timings of Friday prayers after 1:30 pm.

356.title: AMD Days Sale is now live on Amazon
356.article_body: AMD Days Sale on Amazon is now live with offers on thin and light, and gaming laptops powered by AMD Ryzen™ processors. Customers can avail No Cost EMI, exchange offers, and free Prime membership from a wide range of laptops from HP, Lenovo, Acer, Dell, ASUS and MSI. The sale ends on March 19.

357.title: Witnessed how keen Rishi was to complete 'Sharmaji...' after treatment: Neetu
357.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a video of actor and son Ranbir Kapoor talking about his late father Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "This movie will always be very close to my heart!!! I witnessed the excitement when he started the movie and how keen he was to complete it after the treatment," she wrote.

358.title: A very big decision in the interest of Punjabis will be announced shortly: CM Mann
358.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday tweeted, "A very big decision will be taken today in the interest of the people of Punjab." "No one in the history of Punjab would have taken such a decision till date. I'll announce shortly," he added. Mann was sworn in as the CM of the state on Wednesday.

359.title: Lead coffin, likely from 14th cnetury, found under Paris' Notre Dame
359.article_body: Archaeologists have found an ancient lead sarcophagus with well-preserved contents, probably from the 14th century, under Paris' Notre Dame cathedral. Christophe Besnier from France's National Archaeological Institute said a small camera placed inside the sarcophagus showed "cloth remains, organic matter such as hair and plant remains". A pit was also found immediately below the cathedral floor.

360.title: Let them throw me out: Teejay on not being allowed to board Dubai flight over visa issue
360.article_body: Actress Teejay Sidhu was stranded at Delhi airport after not being allowed to board Dubai flight with her three daughters over visa issue. Teejay, who missed the initial flight, claimed Emirates staff members were rude to her and also threatened to call security. She said they weren't allowing her to stay at airport premises, adding, "Let them throw me out."

361.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy personally wrote to Zuckerberg to block Facebook in Russia: Report
361.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reportedly wrote letters to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg asking them to ban Facebook and Instagram from within Russia's borders. However, Meta's President of Global Affairs Nick Clegg replied to the letters, the report said. Facebook restricted certain Russian state media outlets in Ukraine after Zelenskyy's request, it added.

362.title: Delhi Police opposes Shahrukh Pathan's bail plea in 2020 firing case
362.article_body: Delhi Police has opposed the bail plea of Shahrukh Pathan who is accused of allegedly pointing a gun at a constable during the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots and firing three-four rounds of shots. He has a family history of criminal cases, police added. "The accused has been keeping illegal arms and ammunition...has no remorse for his illegal act," police added.

363.title: Mamata Banerjee conspiring to make WB another Pakistan: BJP's Arjun Singh
363.article_body: BJP MP Arjun Singh said West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is "conspiring to make West Bengal another Pakistan". Singh stated that Banerjee is against the Bihari migrants in the state. "Mamata Banerjee has always been against Biharis. Industries in the state are being shut down so that they don't work...Bihar people have given us labour force," Singh said.

364.title: UP man puts tractor silencer on bike, writes 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' on number plate
364.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested three men for riding a bike with the number plate reading 'Bol dena Paal Sahab aaye the' and have seized their bike. The arrested men were identified as Ankit Paal, Anuj Paal and Shivam. Photos showed that the bike was modified and the accused had replaced the silencer of the bike with a tractor's silencer.

365.title: Big B invited us to dinner after Satte Pe Satta got completed: Shakti
365.article_body: Actor Shakti Kapoor said he can watch Satte Pe Satta 200 times. "I watch it whenever I'm sad," he added. The actor recalled that Amitabh Bachchan invited the entire cast for dinner after the film's shoot got completed. "That evening was...fun that we started at 8:30 pm and wrapped it up by 7 am...It was an unforgettable experience," he added.

366.title: Pics show Ukraine theatre before and after Russia dropped powerful bomb
366.article_body: Ukraine's Minister of Foreign Affairs Dmytro Kuleba has posted pics showing the Mariupol theatre before and after Russia dropped a powerful bomb. "Another horrendous war crime in Mariupol...The building is now fully ruined," he wrote. Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov had said that between 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building.

367.title: Good luck finding a wife: Sunny Leone to man who got tattoo of her name
367.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a video with a man who has a tattoo of her name on his arm. "Hope you love me forever!! Because now you have no choice. Good luck finding a wife," she captioned the video. She can be seen wearing yellow and pink saree in video and thanking man with the tattoo.

368.title: Felt horrible, angry from inside during film research: 'The Kashmir...' writer
368.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' writer Saurabh M Pandey said that he felt horrible during the research for the film. "I had to switch to other work...I had to give it some time, I used to feel why did these things happen, used to be very angry from inside...used to be upset and angry at the same time," he added.

369.title: 73,219 posts vacant in paramilitary forces: Nityanand Rai
369.article_body: As many as 73,219 posts are vacant in paramilitary forces due to retirements, resignations, deaths and cadre reviews, MoS for Home Affairs, Nityanand Rai, told the Parliament on Wednesday. "Filling up of vacancies is an ongoing continuous process which is done as per the administrative and operational requirement of the forces," Rai added.

370.title: 3 earthquakes jolt Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh in a day
370.article_body: Three earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh on Wednesday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) informed on Twitter. While two earthquakes with magnitude 5.2 and 4.3 hit Ladakh at 7:05 pm and 7:34 pm respectively, another earthquake measuring 4.2 on the Ritcher scale hit Srinagar at 9:40 pm.

371.title: Babar Azam is the best batter in the world right now: Vaughan
371.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has termed Pakistan captain Babar Azam as the best batter across formats at the moment. "Brilliant across formats," tweeted Vaughan after Babar scored 196 during the second innings in their second Test against Australia. Babar is currently top-ranked batter in ICC rankings in ODIs and T20Is and among the top 10 in Tests.

372.title: Russians shouldn't pay for their authoritarian leader: Patreon CEO
372.article_body: Patreon CEO Jack Conte in an interview said the firm continues to operate in Russia, adding he doesn't believe individual creators "should have to pay for the misdeeds of their authoritarian leader". "They may disagree with the war, and I don't want to punish them," he added. Conte also said the decision on operations was not controversial internally at Patreon.

373.title: 1.75 crore houses completed under PM Awas Yojana-Gramin: Centre
373.article_body: As many as 1.75 crore houses have been completed under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Gramin (PMAY-G), MoS for Rural Development Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti said. Around 2.28 crore houses were sanctioned to the beneficiaries till March 9, 2022, she added. Union Cabinet has approved the continuation of PMAY-G till March 2024 for completion of remaining houses, Jyoti stated.

374.title: Saba Khan shares mother Sharmila Tagore's pics with Pandit Jawaharal Nehru
374.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan's sister Saba Ali Khan took to Instagram to share a video of her mother Sharmila Tagore's pictures, including one with India's first Prime Minister, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. "A star is born...a child protégé...a star. Proud of you! Wish you life's best moments, always...Keep shining," Saba captioned the post.

375.title: Never beaten Deepika in badminton despite trying for 10 years: Ranveer
375.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said he has "never" beaten wife and actress Deepika Padukone in badminton, despite trying for 10 years. "Deepika kicks my butt in badminton. I am running around sweating," added Ranveer. Ranveer and Deepika were last seen together in the film '83'. While Ranveer played cricketer Kapil Dev in the film, Deepika played his wife Romi.

376.title: Want to hold on to that forever: Kim on finding happiness with Pete Davidson
376.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with Pete Davidson, Kim Kardashian said that she decided to seek her happiness and she found it. "I was like...'I'm in my 40s like f**k it...go for it. Find your happiness'," she added. Kim further said she feels "so good" after finding happiness with Pete. "I want to hold on to that forever," she added.

377.title: The tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone: Kirron on 'The Kashmir...'
377.article_body: Talking about 'The Kashmir Files' which stars her husband-actor Anupam Kher, actor-politician Kirron Kher tweeted, "The stark and tragic truth told brilliantly moves everyone." "It is the chronicling of a humanitarian crisis that was ignored for...years," added Kirron. "[Director] Vivek Agnihotri used to hug me..., we cried. It was...one of the most difficult roles," Anupam had earlier said.

378.title: For weeks I have been heckled, threatened, questioned: Man Utd’s Rashford
378.article_body: Reacting to a video of him arguing with a fan who "abused" him after Manchester United's exit from Champions League, forward Marcus Rashford said, "For weeks I've been heckled, threatened, questioned..., my emotion got the better of me." "I [have] been heckled from the minute I stepped foot outside the ground, abuse not just aimed at my football," added Rashford.

379.title: 61,882 arrested in drug trafficking cases in 2021: Govt
379.article_body: A total of 61,882 persons were arrested by the central and state Drug Law Enforcement Agencies (DLEAs) in drug trafficking cases across the country in 2021, the government informed on Wednesday. Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said 99.36% of them were Indians, 0.64% were foreign nationals as per the provisional data of Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB).

380.title: People with new COVID variant had mild symptoms of fever, headaches, muscle dystrophy
380.article_body: Israel has said that two patients who have tested positive for a new variant of COVID-19 had mild symptoms of fever, headaches and muscle dystrophy. It however said that they did not require any special medical intervention. The variant may have originated in Israel, health ministry director-general Nachman Ash said.

381.title: Year's 1st cyclone 'Asani' likely to form over Bay of Bengal on March 21: IMD
381.article_body: This year's first cyclone, 'Asani', is likely to form over the central Bay of Bengal on March 21, said India Meteorological Department (IMD). It is unlikely to cross the Indian coast but heavy rain and strong winds are expected over Andaman and Nicobar Islands. "Our models indicate Asani may cross Bangladesh or adjoining north Myanmar coasts," said an IMD official.

382.title: China's richest billionaires gain $71 billion as stocks jump most since 2008
382.article_body: The combined net worth of China's 75 richest billionaires surged by $71 billion on Wednesday as stocks across Hong Kong and China jumped the most since the 2008 financial crisis. Tencent's Pony Ma, NetEase's William Ding and Pinduoduo's Colin Huang, added over $5 billion each to their net worths, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

383.title: Next two months are going to be special: Rahul as he joins LSG's bubble
383.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul entered the mandatory three-day quarantine ahead of the IPL season and said that the next two months are going to be very special. "The new season gives us a great opportunity as a new franchise to do something special," he added. LSG will play their first match against Gujarat Titans on March 28.

384.title: It told us where we stand: Nagaland captain as Jharkhand score 1,297 runs
384.article_body: Jharkhand qualified for the quarterfinals of the Ranji Trophy 2021-22 after taking a lead of 1,008 runs against Nagaland, having scored 1,297 runs across both innings. Nagaland captain Rongsen Jonathan said he is "happy" to concede 1,297 runs in a match, as it tells them where they stand. Jharkhand's 1,008-run lead marks the highest-ever lead in a first-class match.

385.title: Thought Lara will struggle with on-drives, he hit 3 fours in 1 over: Muralitharan
385.article_body: Muttiah Muralitharan said he tried to dismiss Brian Lara by opening the mid-on area to encourage him to play on-drives, which were difficult to play with the ball spinning during Lara's 221 in Colombo back in 2001. "[Lara] hit three fours in the mid-on region in one over," added Muralitharan. "I am...amazed by the shots [he] played," stated Muralitharan.

386.title: 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners identified, over 30,000 deported: Assam govt
386.article_body: More than 1.44 lakh illegal foreigners have been identified till January 31 on the basis of the Assam Accord, out of which 30,014 have been deported to their country of origin, said the state government on Wednesday. Minister Atul Bora added that 98.35% of fencing work along the India-Bangladesh border in the state has been completed.

387.title: 2 men on high-end racing bike snatch woman's gold chain in Pune; case filed
387.article_body: Two men, riding a high-end racing bike, allegedly snatched a gold chain from a woman riding pillion with her husband on his motorcycle in Pune. The incident reportedly happened on Tuesday night when the couple was returning home after purchasing groceries. The couple has lodged an FIR at Nigdi Police Station. Attempts are on to arrest the robbers, police said.

388.title: 5 arrested for stealing gun of Raghav Chadha's security officer in Punjab
388.article_body: The Nawanshahr police have arrested five persons accused of stealing a revolver from AAP leader Raghav Chadha's security officer during the party's victory roadshow in Amritsar. The police said that the accused were caught after they hit a car with their Scorpio while travelling from Nawanshahr to Khatkar Kalan. The police recovered the stolen revolver during checking.

389.title: Reliance's drastic action came as a surprise: Future Retail on stores' takeover
389.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) has said it's committed to taking all actions "necessary to seek value adjustments and reversal of takeover of stores" by Reliance Industries (RIL). RIL's "drastic and unilateral action" to takeover stores came as a "surprise" to FRL, it added. It also complicated the positive scenario which was building up after the CCI order in December, FRL claimed.

390.title: Delhi court grants bail to man who tried to break into NSA Doval's house
390.article_body: A Delhi court granted bail to a man who was arrested in February for trying to break into National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval's residence on Tughlaq Road. "Considering...the background of accused and the fact that accused is in custody since February 16 and no more is required for investigation, the accused/applicant is admitted to bail," the court added.

391.title: How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?: Cong's Randeep Surjewala
391.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala criticised the Centre and said, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been repatriated?" He added, "How many Kashmiri Pandits have been given jobs?" Addressing a press event, Surjewala said that atrocities had been occurring even during the VP Singh-led government. "Only one party protested. Opposition leader Rajiv Gandhi gheraoed the Parliament," Surjewala added.

392.title: Man hits friend with stone, stabs him to death after argument in Nagpur
392.article_body: A man killed his 24-year-old friend after an argument in Nagpur's Kalmana area. Reports said that the two were consuming alcohol and that the accused slit the victim's throat following an argument, after which, the victim started running. But the accused caught him and hit him in the head with a stone. He then stabbed the victim to death.

393.title: Rizwan saved the Test for us eventually: Babar on Karachi Test
393.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has said it was Mohammad Rizwan who saved Karachi Test for them against Australia after he remained unbeaten at 104. "We took the onus and the main focus was to build partnerships right throughout the day," said Babar, who himself scored 196 runs during their chase of 506 runs. Abdullah Shafique scored 96 in the innings.

394.title: BSF seizes 2 Pakistani fishing boats in Gujarat's Bhuj
394.article_body: Two Pakistani boats were seized by the Border Security Force (BSF) at Sir Creek area in Gujarat's Bhuj on Wednesday. "Movement of two Pakistani fishing boats and four-five Pakistani fishermen was observed by...BSF. The Pakistani fishermen on observing the BSF troops coming towards them fled into the Pakistani territory...BSF...chased them and seized two...boats," BSF said in a statement.

395.title: UK warns Russia 'likely resorting to less precise weapons'
395.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry on Thursday said Russia's failure to control Ukrainian airspace means it has probably "expended far more stand-off air launched weapons than originally planned". "As a result, it is likely Russia is resorting to the use of older, less precise weapons, which are less militarily effective and more likely to result in civilian casualties," the ministry added.

396.title: Shreyas can look 25 & 42 at same time: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad
396.article_body: 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?' director Jayprad Desai said actor Shreyas Talpade can look 25 and 42 at same time. "We always wanted somebody who embodies the body language, the physicality of a cricketer...Shreyas is a powerhouse performer...I was glad when we got to know that he had agreed to come on board and he has delivered an exemplary performance," he added.

397.title: Mumbai lost over 2,000 hectares of urban tree cover in 5 years: Study
397.article_body: Mumbai lost about 2,028 hectares of urban tree cover in the past five years, a study by World Resources Institute (WRI) India revealed. The data published in the Mumbai Climate Action Plan (MCAP) said Central and Western Mumbai recorded the maximum decrease in tree cover. The loss contributed to emission of 19,640.9 tonnes of CO2 per year, the report added.

398.title: Grandmother asks Guj man who he's talking to on call, he hits her with ladle
398.article_body: A 21-year-old man hit his 69-year-old grandmother with a ladle after she asked who he was speaking to over the phone. The grandson, Ruchit, reportedly started abusing her. The woman, Shanta Supehia, asked him not to use foul language against her, following which, he hit her with the ladle. Shanta then started bleeding and her husband came to her rescue.

399.title: Dharmendra shares pic with son Sunny, says 'Rare chance to be with him'
399.article_body: Taking to Twitter, veteran actor Dharmendra shared a picture with his son Sunny Deol, from a vacation in the mountains. The photo showed them posing for the camera with a large, snow-capped mountain behind them. Sharing the picture, Dharmendra wrote, "Extremely happy to be with Sunny. A rare chance to [be] with each other."

400.title: Officials to evaluate pollution impact of Supertech towers demolition
400.article_body: Ahead of the Supertech twin towers demolition in Noida Sector 93A, the state pollution control board will evaluate the amount of pollution which will be caused in the process. "With regard to...pollution aspect, laws will have to be complied (with)," said UPPCB officer Praveen Kumar. The process is expected to briefly cause a spike in the quantity of dust particles.

401.title: Thane man dies by suicide with 11-yr-old daughter, blames police officer
401.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide along with his 11-year-old daughter in Shahapur town of Thane. Victim Vikas Kedare allegedly blamed a police officer in a two-page suicide note, police said. According to police, Kedare and his mother were arrested after his wife died by suicide last year. He was released after spending four months in jail, police added.

402.title: South Korea reports record 6 lakh COVID-19 cases and record 429 deaths in 24 hours
402.article_body: South Korea reported a record 6,21,328 new daily COVID-19 cases, and a record 429 daily deaths, the Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency said on Thursday, amid a wave of Omicron infections. The country reported 55% increase in daily COVID-19 cases. South Korea had reported 4,00,741 cases on Wednesday.
